lines.description: Thin crack around an arete.

lines.name: The Poacher
lines.description: Climb a stellar layback through the first couple bolts, lead rightward to some crimpy face, then haul some bigger stuff to the top and a final mantel. All around great line, albeit a chossy one.

lines.name: The Power of One
lines.description: Technical face climbing into a hard crux.

lines.name: Seams Good
lines.description: Difficult, thin seam.  Stick clip the first bolt and crank hard.  Going right at the crux is much harder.

lines.name: Sympathy for the Devil
lines.description: Great climb with an even greater sequence, botch it and the grade will seem stiff.

lines.name: Tachiana
lines.description: Thin crack.

lines.name: Too Fat to Crimp
lines.description: Immediately right of Loony Toons. Face climbing with with some unique moves to get into and out of the obvious mini-roof mid route. Don't mess it up on the final 10 feet or you're going for a ride! Name refers to me and me only characterizing how I felt the first time I touched this route. Ironically, not a lot of pure crimps on this route

lines.name: 17 Seconds
lines.description: Start as per Dust In The Wind, move right up to a bolt and to a notch, enjoy the easier stuff to the top.

lines.name: Capital C
lines.description: The left route option to Deep Green,  small variation on a different crack system leads to the same anchors.

lines.name: Does Not Deepthroat
lines.description: A route requiring trad experience, Thin climbing up a seam.

lines.name: Dust In The Wind
lines.description: Thin crack to some steep moves and a bolt,  Traverse left to reach the anchors on Deep Green.

lines.name: Eco Terrorist
lines.description: Follow the flake system right of Sorry Squire to the anchors on I Scratched.

lines.name: From The Edge of the Deep Green Sea
lines.description: Climb a shallow crack to a bolt and traverse another crack horizontally, climb the dihedral to anchors.

lines.name: The Grand Master, The Bar Tender and the Clown
lines.description: Climb the blocky start to a ledge, clip the bolt.  Keep following the crack and face to anchors.

lines.name: I Scratched The Record
lines.description: Old schol class.  Follow the obvious finger crack left leaning to the top.  Pull the roof and grab chains.

lines.name: Just Joshin'
lines.description: Climb the blocky flake of The Grand Master, move right and follow the first crack system to the top.

lines.name: Noncreative Garbage
lines.description: Climb the awesome flake to a roof, move right to another crack and towards to anchors.

lines.name: Rideout Crescent
lines.description: Follow the undercling right of I Scratched, turns to layback and anchors.

lines.name: Sorry Squire
lines.description: Climb the blocky flake of The Grand Master, move right and follow the second crack system to the top.

lines.name: That's His Blood
lines.description: Start on That's My Blood, traverse right to the next groove and proceed.

lines.name: That's My Blood
lines.description: Short route that quits due to rock quality.
lines.location: 8m right of 17 seconds, find the groove.

lines.name: 25 and Spanish
lines.description: An old route of unknown origin that is best avoided, sporadic bolt spacing makes this a dangerous endeavor.
lines.location: 2 bolts and anchors from right trad route

lines.name: 45 and French
lines.description: Pull the small roof to a crux halfway up, into easier climbing and anchors.

lines.name: If You Get the Daughter
lines.description: Old bolted variation of Mad River Crack,  albeit bolts were chopped. Climb left and join the Mad River Crack.

lines.name: Mack the Knife
lines.description: Fantastic arete climbing.    Originally put up on gear at 5.9.

lines.name: Mad River Crack
lines.description: Wide crack between Gully and Dank Wall

lines.name: American Socialism
lines.description: Old school line with old school bolting tactics.  Spread out by today's standard to some.  packs a punch to the end.

lines.name: Benevolent Deed
lines.description: Your standard 5.8 fun. anchors below the big roof
lines.location: First bolted climb when entering from the east descent.

lines.name: Block & Tackle
lines.description: Start behind the cedar in a corner, follow the crack up to an old pin and move right through the bulge.
lines.location: Behind the cedar tree, right of the obvious Slippery People crack.

lines.name: Chimney Gully
lines.description: Not a route as much as an easy exit from the crag.
lines.location: Dirty ledge right of Elephant Ivory.

lines.name: Chinese Checkers
lines.description: More contrived Ontario "rock climbing".  Climb the corner to the top.

lines.name: Chinese Democracy
lines.description: Another route that predates revitalization of Devils Glen in recent years.  Great route with great moves, shares anchors with American Socialism.

lines.name: Chinese Torture
lines.description: Overhanging crank to a finger crack.

lines.name: Elephant Ivory
lines.description: Fun moves to a roof, being tall will help you surmount.  Shorter climbers will feel the 10D portion with the outstretch meeting the bulge.  Follow bolts through easier climbing.

lines.name: Farts & Garlic
lines.description: Obscure route in a corner.  overgrown and short.

lines.name: Idle Hands
lines.description: A new Ontario classic, technical limestone climbing.  You won't be dissapointed.

lines.name: Meow
lines.description: Short overhang to start gives way to face climbing before a roof traverse and mantle.
lines.location: Left most sport line on the same wall as Chinese Democracy and American Socialism. Located just right of arete.

lines.name: Mother's Day
lines.description: More obscure climbing in a corner. Seldom traveled and overgrown.

lines.name: Porky Makes Three
lines.description: Steep and overhanging, ohe of the more dedicated .7 trad routes out there.

lines.name: Racer Ready
lines.description: Small crimps and hard moves lets up to an easier middle section, keep it together for the anchor.

lines.name: The Randymizer
lines.description: Overhanging seam of impossible dreams.

lines.name: Ruff
lines.description: Left of Chinese Democracy with a boulder style start requiring a manual before a second interesting move midway up.
lines.location: Left of Chinese Democracy and about 14 feet right of the arete.

lines.name: Seams Better
lines.description: Thin and very thought provoking, will seem like a sandbag your first couple rounds.  Eases up before the roof, save some for the finish.

lines.name: Six Tense
lines.description: Climb the small dihedral, at the roof go left for 5.5 and right for 5.6.

lines.name: Slippery People
lines.description: As good as Ontario trad gets! Splitter crack.

lines.name: That 10B
lines.description: Climb the seam to a small overhang, pull the crux move to gain better feet and hit the anchor.

lines.name: Bosch Goggles
lines.description: Bolted adventure, not a great route and not recommended unless you like type 2 fun.

lines.name: Bye Bye Mother
lines.description: Further right from Helios, you'll come across a fun-looking corner splitter just left of 3 large trees near the wall and Peach Sparrow. Good and relatively safe practice route for bigger gear placement.

lines.name: Catch the Sun
lines.description: Powerful body tension on thin moves, balance your way to a headwall crux that tends to chew up and spit out.

lines.name: Helios
lines.description: Just right of Ra. Climb trends rightwards. A good beginner option.

lines.name: Legends of the Fall
lines.description: An amazing mix of technical footwork and powerful, fingery climbing on a slightly overhanging wall. Boulder up to the "horn of Africa" feature and then head leftwards onto the face. Making your way up to the tooth on the prominent bulge will require precise footwork and strong fingers. A surprisingly good hold after gives you a chance to catch your breath and muster some power for the finish.      Like some of the other routes at Devil's Glen, this was originally bolted (very spaciously) by an unknown climber before the modern discovery of the crag.
lines.location: The second route to the right of the dirty squeeze chimney at the left of the Sun Worshipper Wall. Identifiable by a flattened hanger near the base.

lines.name: Peach Sparrow
lines.description: Big reaches on bomber holds, hard part is at the chains.

lines.name: Pinball Wizard
lines.description: Squeeez Chimney. Also a 5.0 descent before the FA.
lines.location: Far left of the Sun Worshiper Wall

lines.name: Pyralgina
lines.description: Deadpoints and body tension to a good rest. Then pull through a short but exciting finish.

lines.name: Ra
lines.description: Just right of Sun Worshipper. Start off on the large disjointed crack, follow the line through to a mini crack before the anchors.

lines.name: Rise
lines.description: An old deviation of Catch The Sun, taken out by FA.  Listed for historical purposes.

lines.name: Sun Worshipper
lines.description: The left of the "easier" slab routes. Climb up and delicately traverse left. A cryptic crux waits here. Figure it out and head into easier climbing and laybacks near the anchors.

lines.name: Sunny Chibas
lines.description: Early boulder sequence and a big-ish move leads to easier climbing above
lines.location: Starts on the first bolt line left of Sun Worshipper. Uses old anchors for Rise

lines.name: Temple of The Sun
lines.description: Bolted crack line. little chossy up top.

lines.name: Wild Fire
lines.description: Technical barely there, face climbing.  Bouldery and difficult.

lines.name: 2020 Division
lines.description: Split like Olympic aspirations, first half consists of technical sequences while the top is overhanging and mildly easier. Stick clip it.

lines.name: Attention All Shoppers
lines.description: barely retrobolted after a gear ascent.  Heady and commiting.

lines.name: Barnes Project
lines.description: Closed Project
lines.location: Bolt line right of Prowject, red tape. Stay off.

lines.name: Bolts left Your Wife
lines.description: Slab climb featuring finger cracks and several hidden finger pockets.
lines.location: First bolted line on the north west face of the "tight Canyon" area. Located right of the arête that Mullicious is on.

lines.name: Dirty 11
lines.description: An old dirty 11 seldom travelled.

lines.name: Dirty But Fun
lines.description: Another old route.  Adventure climbing style.

lines.name: Does She Go?
lines.description: Climb the corner left of "EBTKS".

lines.name: Donald Pump
lines.description: V3 boulder problem to 2nd bolt, proceed towards the seam.  Potential dyno is necessary depending on height to gain the overhanging headwall.  Cruise the dihedral to anchors.

lines.name: Everything But The Kitchen Sink
lines.description: Little bit if everything, except the kitchen sink.

lines.name: Hillary Crimpin'
lines.description: V2 boulder problem, with a blank slab section to a large overhang delivers a little bit of everything.

lines.name: The Invasion
lines.description: Climb the roof into a corner, and pull some more roof.  Follow the cracks and corners to anchors.

lines.name: Kansai
lines.description: Climb up the face on good holds towards the first bolt.  When the holds disappear you will be acutely aware of the fact that the first bolt is still well out of reach, and the distance to the ground will make you think long and hard about the consequences of a fall.  Pull the crux, then clip the first bolt.  You're not home free; there's still groundfall potential above, but at least the climbing will be easier.  Continue up the face and into a corner system on well spaced bolts to the chains.  This was a trad route until it was retrobolted.  It's still not a sport route, though.
lines.location: At least one of the guidebooks places this route to the right of a tree that is no longer standing (it's on the ground).  Located approximately 50 meters left of prowject (the prominent, severely overhanging, arete).
lines.protection: Bolts.  Stick clip recommended.  However if you're worried about falling on a 5.10a, you'd probably be better off just hopping on something else.

lines.name: Lucky
lines.description: Technical slab with a steep roof finish

lines.name: Mullicious
lines.description: slab arete, fun climbing.

lines.name: The Prowject
lines.description: Steep, long boulder problem.  Look at that prow!

lines.name: Ramek
lines.description: Finger crack on a short angled wall. Left of Say No More.

lines.name: Say No More
lines.description: Left trending hand crack on the right side of the crevice.

lines.name: Scream Dream
lines.description: Great route just right of Prowject.  Finishes half way up the wall.

lines.name: Shibuya
lines.description: Climb the discontinuous right trending crack system for three bolts to a rest.  Finish with big holds on steepish rock.
lines.location: At least one of the guidebooks places this route to the left of a tree that is no longer standing (it's on the ground).  Located approximately 50 meters left of prowject (the prominent, severely overhanging, arete).

lines.name: Silly Putty
lines.description: Nice crack 5m right of the canyon exit, Follow up to a V shaped groove. Hard for the grade.

lines.name: Thamel
lines.description: Climb by an arete, but wouldn't call it an arete climb.    There is a wall behind you so be careful if you whip.  To avoid swinging, it is recommended you clip into the second draw from the ground (ie skip the first draw) or unclip the first draw from the ground after you clip into the second draw.  By the second bolt there are rocks that look loose.  They are fine to pull on, but make sure you double check by tapping the rocks.  There is a nice ledge right before the anchors.
lines.location: Start is just left of the arete/at the arete.

lines.name: Thursites
lines.description: Dingy, dirty crack right of Your Wife.

lines.name: Turd Overhang
lines.description: Steep arete. Bolts on sketchy blocks and tight quarters for belayer and observers.
lines.location: On the island, directly across from Everything But The Kitchen Sink

lines.name: Water Over the Bridge
lines.description: As per Nathan Lewis: Bolted line with a long chain 2/3 the way up. Chose one of two entrances — tech the face for a sport climbers paradise, or lie back the crack with the tree at the bottom and use the right of two bolts to merge with the direct line — grade doesn’t change. Fun flowy climbing with interesting movement to a tricky thin boulder problem guarding the chains. Often wet at the bottom.

lines.name: White Rabbit
lines.description: Newly bolted route right of Kansai that starts in a short dihedral before continuing into several flakes and ledges in the same crack system. I have not confirmed the grade but was told 5.11a, feel free to update.5.11a. Climb up on to the ledge on the right and traverse left to the flake where you'll meet the crux before getting to a nice ledge for a rest. Rest well at the ledge before making your way up to the anchors on easy climbing.Watch out for the tree at the first ledge. Rope will sometimes get stuck at the tree when cleaning and pulling the rope in the end.

lines.name: Your Wife
lines.description: Follow the face and cracks on the left side.

lines.name: Boater Boy
lines.description: Not amazing, but fun start from the boat. First bolt is 2 feet above the water to tie the boat into, go up and traverse left to the anchors. Lowers off onto solid ground.

lines.name: Cheese & Wine
lines.description: Fun little route, one move above the 2nd bolt to a big hold.
lines.location: Park your boat under the jumping rocks, left of Boater Boy

lines.name: Chicken on a raft - Left start
lines.description: Left start of ...........

lines.name: Strongbow
lines.description: Far left route on the splash wall

lines.name: Storm Watch
lines.description: Storm watch sds starts low on a ledge on on the left side of the boulder and heads up and diagonally right to Topo at the highest point around the top right of the boulder. beta vids on YouTube.

lines.name: Vultures
lines.description: Sds on the right side of "the eagle" boulder and work up some crimps to Topo the same as storm watch.
lines.location: Right side of the eagle boulder matched on a small ledgey hold

lines.name: Land Shark
lines.description: The first move's a tough one! the rest is much more enjoyable. Topo.
lines.location: sds middle of the land shark boulder

lines.name: Adroit
lines.description: This was previously described as a Trad Route in the old guidebook that has been retrobolted. It is just right of Chained to a Madman. The second last bolt has a very old pin right beside it. Fun climb!

lines.name: Cardiac Arete
lines.description: Climb the obvious right curving hand crack (gear) and follow the line of bolts above.
lines.location: Bolted (optional gear placement at the start or stick-clip).

lines.name: Caribbean Cruise
lines.description: Follow the crack to a cedar above then step left and climb the crack through trees to the top.

lines.name: Chained to a Madman
lines.description: Nice relaxing 5.7. Easiest way to start it to climb left of the starting bolt. Bolts move to the right as you go. Crux is near the top, but there is a really nice jug straight after.
lines.location: There is a trail that runs east of the picnic tables. Follow that through the forest until you reach the crag. First bolt is directly infront of a rock pile that looks like a chair.
lines.protection: Route has achors at the top and plenty of bolts. Bring 12 draws.

lines.name: Churning in the Bunny
lines.description: This Route Shares Bolts and anchors with Hands against the crown Jewels (5.10d)For the 5.9 variation , stay near the crack to the right of the bolts. (Especially after the third bolt). Clipping the 4th bolt is a bit tricky.For the 5.10d Variation, stay close to the bolts (leaning more to the left), (you will feel it if you are on the 10d)
lines.location: first bolt just above the ledge,

lines.name: Corner Route
lines.description: Climb the right-facing corner to a large ledge. Continue up and slightly right past a short wall to the top.

lines.name: Dragline
lines.description: An excellent moderate route. Climb the obvious long dihedral system about 20m left of Chimney. Either climb through the roof, or traverse 3m right to a ledge then back left to regain the original line above the roof. Watch for movement stopping rope drag if attempting the traverse finish.
lines.location: No fixed anchors. Top out and rap down nearby to the right at rap station.

lines.name: Flaked Out
lines.description: Follow the crack system to an overhang. Move right to an undercling and pull the roof/layback and climb to the top.
lines.location: This routes shares the same start as Wally's Groove which is found at No. 4

lines.name: Freedom Tickling
lines.description: One of the easier identifiable routes in the central wall of kelso, light brown rock allows for interesting movement. After the light brown area (past the small roof) you enter some vegetation (be ready to eat some grass) Ensure to go through the small roof for full value. (Do not go right through easier ledges when arriving at the roof)Be careful of loose rock on the bottom of the climb!

lines.name: Jolly Roger
lines.description: Typically done in two pitches because of rope drag. Rockfall has altered the first pitch.   Pitch 1 Climb up to a large ledge.   Pitch 2 Climb up the groove the traverse left on top of one overhang and under another. Climb the open book to the top.

lines.name: Picnic
lines.description: Climb the open book to the left of Chimney. Move left across easy rock at the top or pull through the overhanging face above.

lines.name: Rick's Ramble
lines.description: Climb the corner and chimney to a bushwack to the top.

lines.name: Road to Ruin
lines.description: Climb the airy arete to the right of dragline

lines.name: Summit Jitters
lines.description: The layback finger crack 5m right of Rick's Ramble.

lines.name: Traverse
lines.description: From a grassy ledge follow a right-facing flake system to the top.

lines.name: Wally's Groove
lines.description: Follow the crack system to an overhang. Avoid this by going left then up to the top.
lines.location: The start of this route is shared with Flaked Out and can be found at No. 4.

lines.name: Zip
lines.description: Strenuous, protects well

name: Halfway Log Dump (Bruce Peninsula National Park)

lines.name: Emerald Allsorts
lines.description: A real gem. Boat start. From the obvious jug at the bottom of the shield make some tricky long moves to gain the flatty jugs below the roof, turn this on good holds to gain the hanging groove. NB you can step right at the ledge for any of these routes to do 10 feet of about 5.6 to the very top.

lines.name: Jellification Nation
lines.description: Nice moves up the little arete lead to a rockover, before stepping left to gain the hanging groove. The height is no where near 60 ft, as per the 5.7 description, it's 35 ft max. Also, the climbing is pretty safe, and you don't need to jump in to get down
lines.location: Same start as the existing 5.7 - you can also access this by climbing in from the R.

lines.name: Lugia's Aeroblast
lines.description: This route begins on a ledge right near the water. This is where you get off your boats and begin climbing. You will first traverse to the far left of the face. Then you will proceed upwards. At around 15 feet you get to a nice ledge where you can plan the rest of the climb here, you can take a left and climb a dihedral, I did not climb this one. I went straight up and climbed the small crack that is directly under a tree. There are some loose rocks to the right of the overhanging tree. This rock has been climbed before so there are sure to be routes that others have done.
lines.location: Lake of Bays, Ontario, Canada. The start is a ledge you can just step right off of the boat and chalk up. The only safe way to descend is jumping of the ledge by the tree. You COULD keep going to top out after the ledge near the tree. But this is very dangerous for if you fall you will hit the ledge. The most obvious landmark is the large dihedral and a overhanging tree. These are commonly called by locals the 'dorset rocks' and the 'dorset jumping rocks' as it is a very popular destination to jump from.
lines.protection: NO PROTECTION. This is DWS, falling will result in you scraping down the rock unless you manage to push off.

lines.name: Barking Baritones
lines.description: Left of Stinger and not quite as good.

lines.name: Feeling Dolomighty
lines.description: Rappel at the east (hiker's right) side of the area at the top of Scalphunter to the hanging belay. It's also possible to climb the first part of Limestone Cowboy to get to the hanging belay. Climb up while moving right to a cool finish.

lines.name: Feeling Groovey
lines.description: Rappel at the east (hiker's right) side of the area at the top of Scalphunter to the hanging belay. It's also possible to climb the first part of Limestone Cowboy to get to the hanging belay. Climb the channel to a wide crack.

lines.name: Gateway to the Vertical World
lines.description: Climb the line on the left end of the ledge and move through continuous climbing to a crux through pockets.

lines.name: Limestone Cowboy
lines.description: This route starts where the Stinger gulley descent ends at the bottom of the cliff. Start in a dihedral, eventually moving up and right to wander to the top.

lines.name: The Mandate
lines.description: The furthest right route on the dark colored rock, this is a quality route except for the dihedral near the beginning.

lines.name: Paradigm Shift
lines.description: The leftmost climb on the dark rock contains some nice face climbing and starts in a dihedral.

lines.name: Quantum Utensils
lines.description: Middle route on the black rock, take the blank face to the top.

lines.name: Scalphunter
lines.description: Move up the rightmost bolted line on the ledge to the top of the cliff.

lines.name: Spirit in the Sky
lines.description: The middle line on the ledge, this interesting line moves up the face to the top.

lines.name: Stinger
lines.description: This route starts most of the way down the descent gulley just before the final hand rope. Short but nice.

lines.name: American Bucks
lines.description: Namesake of the wall. Rappel to the hanging belay in a corner and move right to the arete and up on good holds.

lines.name: Ascent to Olympus
lines.description: Rappel to the same hanging belay as American Bucks. Climb the crack/corner on the left to a face with bolts.

lines.name: Curses from the Underworld
lines.description: This route is accessed by rappelling at a gulley at the left side of this crag to a ledge. This is an offwidth crack requiring large gear.

lines.name: Dandy
lines.description: Rappel down just east (climber's left) of Kiss of the Spider Woman to the hanging belay.  There is a "D" painted in blue at the top of the cliff to locate this climb. Take the mostly vertical face up from the hanging belay.

lines.name: Global Warming
lines.description: Starting on the same ledge as Curses from the Underworld, this route moves right and finishes near the left side of Dandy.

lines.name: Kiss of the Spider Woman
lines.description: The other namesake and classic line on this wall. Rappel down to the hanging belay, located by the letters "KS" painted at the top of the cliff.

lines.name: White Fang
lines.description: This is the furthest west (climber's right) route on this wall. Rappel down to the hanging belay and climb the thin face to the top.

lines.name: Bananarama
lines.description: This two pitch aid line consists of thin gear and hooks and starts at a hanging belay under the B-52 overhang.
lines.location: Hanging belay, thin gear and hooks

lines.name: Forever Expired
lines.description: This is the obvious route that goes up under the B-52 overhang. Long and varied climbing leads to the top of the cliff. This route was done by Sonnie Trotter in 2004 and is the hardest route in Ontario.

lines.name: Banshee
lines.description: The namesake of the cliff for a reason, this great trad line takes a thin crack to some face climbing, finally finishing with a hand crack to the top of the cliff.  There is a painted "B" at the top of the cliff to mark the top of this climb.
lines.location: Fingers and hand sized gear. There may be a pin and/or a bolt after the finger crack at the start of the face climbing.

lines.name: Light 'n' Easy
lines.description: Climb to a ledge, clipping two bolts along the way; take the obvious crack from the ledge to the top of the cliff plugging gear along the way.

lines.name: My Left Foot
lines.description: Climb a corner up to a roof and then to the top.

lines.name: Nash the Slash
lines.description: Brutal offwidth!

lines.name: Unnamed
lines.description: Rappel to the hanging belay and climb the face to the top.

lines.name: Crescent Moon
lines.description: The other namesake of this wall climbs, you guessed it, the crescent-like feature that is bookended by face climbing at the beginning and end of the climb.
lines.location: Mixed - some medium gear for the arching crack and draws for the bolts on the face.

lines.name: Crucible
lines.description: Start from the ground near a very large tree and move into a corner where you stem to the top.

lines.name: Everything is Illuinated
lines.description: Start the same as Not Another Mantle but go even further left, eventually moving through bulges to a high crux.

lines.name: Flying Squirrel
lines.description: Hard movement on great rock, excellent line.

lines.name: Ghost and the Darkness
lines.description: Another tough line on this wall, this thin route takes on some dark rock to the top.

lines.name: Lord of the Flies
lines.description: One of the namesakes of the cliff, this line starts just behind a large dead tree and climbs up the streaked face.

lines.name: Not Another Mantle
lines.description: Start up the large tree mentioned in the description for Crucible and take the bolt line that heads up and left (gold hangers).

lines.name: Open Project
lines.description: Open project.

lines.name: Pow Wow Highway
lines.description: Linkup - Start the same as for Everything is Illuminated and move far left to meet up with The Victim at its second bolt and take it to the top.

lines.name: Project
lines.description: Also a hanging belay, this project is expected to be in the 12+ range. Rappel from the top, east (climber's left) of The Victim.

lines.name: Unnamed
lines.description: Climb up starting on the arete just right of an offwidth.

lines.name: Unnamed2
lines.description: Another route without a name on this cliff. *This route does not currently have an ending.*

lines.name: The Victim
lines.description: The only hanging belay on the wall but an excellent line. Rappel from the top of the cliff at a jut-out to the hanging belay and move up on long moves.

lines.name: Big Ben
lines.description: Rappel to the hanging belay and climb the face to the top.

lines.name: Cave Route
lines.description: Rappel to the hanging belay and clip bolts and fixed threads to the "cave" then move out to the top.

lines.name: Change of Season
lines.description: The only trad route on the wall, climb the crack climber's left of Big Ben to steeper climbing near the finish.

lines.name: Cumulus
lines.description: The namesake of the crag, this excellent line contains face climbing to an overhang with better holds. Rappel from the top at a blue painted "C" at the cliff top that marks the top of this climb.

lines.name: Distant Thunder
lines.description: Rappel just east (hiker's right) of Cumulus to climb the face that ends with a roof near the top.

lines.name: Pirates
lines.description: Rappel from trees at the west (hiker's left, climber's right) end of the lookout at the cliff top.

lines.name: Shakedown
lines.description: Rappel down just west (hiker's left) of Cumulus and climb up to an awkward roof then to the top.

lines.name: The Wax Bomb
lines.description: Rappel just east (hiker's right) of Pirates to the hanging belay; climb past the thin start to find easier climbing to the top.

lines.name: American Dream
lines.description: This route starts 50 feet east (climber's left) of the Latvian Ledge area and contains several boulder problems up a varied face.

lines.name: Azrael
lines.description: Rappel just past Latvian Ledge to a one bolt belay or do the direct start which is Gargamel & Azrael. Climb the crack to the top.

lines.name: Bandit
lines.description: Rappel to a hanging belay on the white face and climb a brutal thin face.

lines.name: Bareback
lines.description: Dynamic climbing through several boulder problems marks this good climb that goes up just left of The Fin.

lines.name: Blue Bottle Chronic
lines.description: Rappel from the top of the cliff approximately 250 feet past (east of) the Latvian Ledge area to the hanging belay and climb the face to a roof.

lines.name: Bottlerocket
lines.description: Rappel to the hanging belay and climb the face to a small roof.

lines.name: Brokeback Mountaineer
lines.description: Start as for Bareback but move left after the first bolt. Climb the right side of the roof and move through the interesting finish.

lines.name: The Fin
lines.description: The namesake of this cliff and a popular line moves through an obvious black fin feature up through interesting moves near the top.

lines.name: Gargamel & Azrael
lines.description: This line is the direct start to the trad line Azrael and adds some difficult movement at the beginning on a bolted steep face. Bring small to medium gear for the Azrael crack finish.

lines.name: Glass Bottom Boat
lines.description: Climb over fragile rock to a bolt and continue on a crack to a roof.

lines.name: The Golden Hour
lines.description: Start just to the left of Brokeback Mountaineer at the far left side of the choss ledge. Easier climber brings you to a no-hands rest where you can ponder the harder arete to come.

lines.name: Project
lines.description: Project

lines.name: The Scenic Route
lines.description: Start as for Brokeback Mountaineer but take the roof straight on and move left through a wandering route to the top.

lines.name: To Catch a Thief
lines.description: Rappel from the same point as Bandit but use the hanging belay just to the east (climber's left). Another thin line.

lines.name: Death by Spanking
lines.description: The next lookout east (off of blue trail) of For the Gallery; rappel to a ledge. Climb the slick slab.

lines.name: Fish in a Barrel
lines.description: This line climbs just left of Turbine off of the same ledge. The rock may be of poor quality.

lines.name: For the Gallery
lines.description: Hanging belay. Rappel next to the lookout near the blue trail. It is also possible to climb from the base to a loose ledge to the hanging belay.

lines.name: Grey Matter
lines.description: Located just east (climber's left) of Lioness. This steep route starts from the ground and rises to a grey vertical face.

lines.name: Headspace
lines.description: Hanging belay. The route that the wall is named after. This route is just west of where the approach trail meets the cliff edge. Rappel down the black face to the hanging belay anchors.

lines.name: Jack in the Pulpit
lines.description: Located just east (climber's left) of Headspace. Rappel to a ledge and climb a crack system to a feature known as the pulpit.

lines.name: Lioness
lines.description: Starts from a ledge just east (climber's left) of Jack in the Pulpit.

lines.name: Long Weekend Ledge
lines.description: This line climbs out the left side of the ledge that that Fish in a Barrel and Turbine start on.

lines.name: The Mentor
lines.description: This route climbs from the ground with a tough boulder problem followed by more hard climbing. The route eventually merges right into Soul to Soul.

lines.name: Project
lines.description: Project - difficulty unknown

lines.name: Pushin' Up Daddies
lines.description: This route climbs from the ground near Soul to Soul, up a loose corner to more solid rock up higher.

lines.name: Scooped
lines.description: This is a mixed line that is located climber's left of Pushin' Up Daddies.

lines.name: Soul to Soul
lines.description: Hanging belay. Rappel to the hanging belay about 100 feet east (climber's left) of where the approach trail meets the cliff. Tough movement right at the start.

lines.name: Tooth Brush Was Not Enough
lines.description: This is the furthest route to the east (climber's left) of the Headspace Wall. This line climbs a corner and may stay wet until late in the season.

lines.name: Turbine
lines.description: This climb is located just east (climber's left) of Death by Spanking. The climb starts on a ledge with a tough boulder start.

lines.name: Zulie's Trad Line
lines.description: Zulie's Trad Line

lines.name: 45th Parallel
lines.description: Climb the steep overhanging dihedral feature left of Man Overboard.  This good new route will get even better after it sees a few ascents.

lines.name: Cracker
lines.description: Rappel just east (hiker's right) of Pickpocket to a hanging belay at a tree and one bolt. Climb the face and crack (fingers to hand sized gear optional) to the top.
lines.location: Hanging belay at tree and one bolt, fingers to hand sized gear optional for crack.

lines.name: Elmo in Space
lines.description: Climber's left about 150 feet from Man Overboard, this line starts in a corner and moves left to a bolted face. Use gear in the corner to gain the bolted face.

lines.name: Free Peltier
lines.description: Start on the ramp and clip the bolts furthest up the ramp, climbing up to a roof. Traverse over to Niagro and finish up there.

lines.name: The Honey Badger
lines.description: Just left of Skunks do it in Tevas, climb the face to the top.

lines.name: Lady Slipper
lines.description: The namesake of this crag and a classic line, start on the right side of the ledge and climb the face to an easier finish.

lines.name: Magica Moment
lines.description: Just left of Ladyslipper, a tough start leads to easier climbing.

lines.name: Man Overboard
lines.description: At the left end of the ledge, climb the techy arete to a face.

lines.name: Master! Teach Me the Secrets of the Universe
lines.description: About 250 feet left of Kung-Fu, this line heads up the cliff with technical movement. Be careful on the fragile rock at the beginning of the climb.

lines.name: Mixed Martial Arts
lines.description: Ascend the large corner system just right of "So You Think You Know Good Kung-Fu." The climb starts with stemming and face climbing past several well spaced bolts, which can be backed up with some gear.  After reaching a stance, the corner kicks back to a gentle overhang and the crack climbing begins in earnest.  Jam, layback, and smear your way up the next 10 meters to arrive at the chains.
lines.location: Just right of "So You Think You Know Good Kung-Fu."  About 25 meters left of the Ladyslipper Ledge.

lines.name: Niagro
lines.description: Just left of Free Peltier, climb fragile rock at the start (careful!) to a rest, finally heading up and left to the anchors.

lines.name: Pickpocket
lines.description: Rappel to a hanging belay about 300 feet east (hiker's right) of a lookout. Climb up the slabby short face.

lines.name: Skunks Do it in Tevas
lines.description: Climb the arete to a technical ending near the top.

lines.name: The Slugmeister's High-Techs
lines.description: Start from the left side of the ledge and climb through long moves to an easier finish.

lines.name: So! Maybe You Need a Lesson in Humility!
lines.description: Just left of Kung-Fu, this route has a lot of fragile and very loose rock at the beginning.

lines.name: So! You Think You Know Good Kung-Fu?
lines.description: About 75 feet climber's left from Elmo in Space; climb the right side of the wall up this continuous route. *60m rope required.

lines.name: Burn Judy Burn
lines.description: The left line on the boulder and the hardest of the three contains some nice climbing.

lines.name: Ring of Fire
lines.description: This is the middle line and is also the longest of the three.

lines.name: Unnamed
lines.description: The rightmost line on the boulder; not quite as good or as hard as the other two lines but still worth doing.

lines.name: Anarchy in High Heels
lines.description: Start as for Fleet Footed Rock Moose but take the left bolt line up.

lines.name: Bart's Yellow Scooter
lines.description: This route starts from the far right side of the ledge and moves through tough technical climbing to the top.

lines.name: Busted at Berford
lines.description: Start as for Lefty but move up and right up the slightly slabby line.

lines.name: Curveball
lines.description: The left of the two cracks, this great trad line moves up and left to the top.
lines.location: Fingers to hand sized trad gear.

lines.name: Doggies Dirt Pipe
lines.description: The furthest left bolt line on the ledge is this very nice varied route.

lines.name: Fastball
lines.description: The right of the two cracks, this often-wet route is nice when dry.

lines.name: Fleet Footed Rock Moose
lines.description: A nearly vertical line that starts left around the corner from Plastic Victory.  Stick to the right bolt line to the top.

lines.name: Green Velvet
lines.description: Another off-vertical route that's a bit tougher; climb flakes to a roof and then take it to the top, ending at the same anchor as Anarchy in High Heels.

lines.name: Lefty
lines.description: The first bolt line to the right of the rappel dihedral, this route starts by climbing the corner and then moving up the face.

lines.name: Plastic Victory
lines.description: Similar to Surf Zone, this route climbs just left of it and also goes up slabby rock to the top.

lines.name: Project
lines.description: Start the same as Bart's Yellow Scooter but go straight up through hard moves (instead of moving right as you do on Bart's).

lines.name: Sargasso Sea
lines.description: Just left of the two cracks, this route climbs the difficult looking slab.

lines.name: Shorty Long Back
lines.description: Just left of the ledge proper, climb up to a roof and finish on a flake. As with many routes, be careful on the starting chossy rock.

lines.name: Surf Zone
lines.description: The first bolted line to the left of the rappel corner, this is one of several decent slab lines that moves through some bulges on lower angle rock.

lines.name: Viva From the Ground
lines.description: A variation/link up that climbs Viva La Difference from the ground, start on Shorty Long Back and merge right into Viva La Difference.

lines.name: Viva La Difference
lines.description: About 80 feet past (east) of the rappel for the Latvian Ledge area proper, rappel to a hanging belay and climb the seam and face to the top.

lines.name: Zone of Extreme Beauty
lines.description: Climb the line of bolts just right of the two cracks, Fastball and Curveball, and search your way to the top.

lines.name: The Cave of Despair
lines.description: This route is located in a hallway/cave on the way down to the beach from the Titan Wall. This desperate looking line is usually wet.

lines.name: Cold Hard Beach
lines.description: The leftmost route on the Life's a Beach Boulder, take the bolt line up and left to the roof and follow it around to the right and the anchors.

lines.name: LoreLai
lines.description: An amazing climb in a spectacular position right above the water. Climb up easy terrain and clip the first bolt. A long draw here will keep the rope off the lip. Traverse out on jugs, until you can gain the large, granite-esque flake in the roof. Get a quick rest at the top of the flake, then bust a big move out right and launch into the crux boulder problem. Keep it together on the top, and reward yourself with a nice dip in the lake. - Tony Brengosz

lines.name: Madagascar
lines.description: This is the rightmost line on the boulder.

lines.name: Open Top Rope Project
lines.description: This steep toprope project heads up the underside of the wall on the side of the boulder facing the water.

lines.name: Big Kahuna
lines.description: The first route to the right of the rappel dihedral, an extremely varied, extremely hard, and extremely thin route.

lines.name: Coeur de Lion
lines.description: An excellent line featuring thin pockets, this is the second bolt line climber's right of the rappel dihedral.

lines.name: Dandelion Whine
lines.description: Slab start to steep finish, this line is the first one left of the corner.

lines.name: I Wonder Where the Hanging Belays Are
lines.description: Climb I Wonder Where the Lions Are from the ground to add one letter of difficulty.

lines.name: I Wonder Where the Lions Are
lines.description: A classic line with a hanging belay, rappel down 10 feet west of the rappel dihedral and climb the technical line to the top.

lines.name: The Lion King
lines.description: The furthest right line on the ledge, another very thin line moves up through multiple boulder problems.

lines.name: Lost at Sea
lines.description: Climb from the Lost at Sea ledge and climb the vert face to gain larger holds to the finish.

lines.name: Margin of Terror
lines.description: Go west (hiker's left, climber's right) from the Lost at Sea rappel corner to another lookout. Rappel down to the hanging belay and climb up and right before moving back left near the top.

lines.name: New Way Out
lines.description: Slab start the trends to the left, follow the left most set of bolts from here. Multiple pockets and small slab sections finishing on overhanging large jug style pockets.
lines.location: Left most line on the Lost at Sea Ledge sharing a common slab start with Lost at Sea and Dandelion Whine.
lines.protection: Bolted with fixed quick draw anchors.

lines.name: Thor
lines.description: Rappel the same as for Margin of Terror but move climber's left to a different hanging belay. Climb the excellent vertical line to the top.

lines.name: Thor from the Floor
lines.description: Climb Thor from the ground to bump the difficulty to 13a by adding four bolts of difficult climbing.

lines.name: Making Waves
lines.description: Rappel at the point described in the wall overview and climb this very nice technical route.

lines.name: Maneline
lines.description: Rappel at the point described in the wall overview at a painted "M" at the top of the cliff. An ultra classic 5.10, this route climbs right from the hanging belay to the dihedral and then straight to the top of the wall. It is also possible to climb this route from the ground.

lines.name: Manelining
lines.description: Start up the same as Maneline (clipping the first two bolts) and head up and left plugging gear along the way.
lines.location: Mixed - clip the first two bolts and then use trad gear to the top. A wire is required to cinch around a fixture bolt hanger.

lines.name: Pipeline
lines.description: A linkup of sorts, this route climbs Maneline from the ground, moving left just before the hanging belay, going through a couple of bolts on a bulge to reach more climbing to the top. This route ends just left of the fixture hanger on Manelining.

lines.name: Queue de Lion
lines.description: Rappel near the west (hiker's left) end of the wall to reach this hanging belay. Climb the slab start to a more vertical middle and finish on this excellent moderate.

lines.name: Intergalactic Cantaloupes
lines.description: A bit left of Melon is this line which consists of mostly technical climbing on edges.

lines.name: Open Project
lines.description: This partially bolted route is an open project on the left side of this wall.

lines.name: Shacked
lines.description: Rappel near a white rock at the cliff top to get to this hanging belay. Start up a lower angle arete to a steeper finish.

lines.name: The United Colors of Melon
lines.description: This line goes up the black rock at the right end of the ledge. Balance and tech up the slab to reach the more overhanging wall above.

lines.name: [Redacted]
lines.description: The best route on the wall, this route starts on the right side of the ledge and consists of very good face climbing. There is a large dyno at the crux that can be avoided by climbing a bit to the right (although it is probably easier than 12b this way).

lines.name: In a Rut
lines.description: Climb the crack just left of the ledge you rappel to.

lines.name: Merchants and Thieves
lines.description: Namesake of the wall, this mixed line starts down off the ledge of the previous routes.
lines.location: Mixed - bolts with medium sized gear useful.

lines.name: Renegade
lines.description: This is the leftmost sport line on the ledge you rappel to and climbs up a sustained face.

lines.name: Summers End
lines.description: Just right of Renegade and rather similar to it.

lines.name: Attila the Hung
lines.description: A typical chossy start changes to a weird crack that leads to a roof.

lines.name: Breaking Dinner Plates
lines.description: Find the easiest way you can up the cliff, plugging gear along the way.

lines.name: Green Eyed Monster
lines.description: Best route on the wall. Climb the face on the right side of the ledge.

lines.name: Middle Aged Ninja Tortoise
lines.description: This gear line is about 30 feet right of the Monster Ledge and starts up a ramp before moving up and right.

lines.name: Mr. Moderate
lines.description: Climb the short dihedral on the left side of the ledge.

lines.name: Nominal Nominal
lines.description: Climb up clipping one bolt along the way and then continue up the crack formed by stone blocks.

lines.name: Schools Out
lines.description: Climb the face just left of the Mr. Moderate dihedral.

lines.name: The Troll
lines.description: This route starts from the ground just to the right of Green Eyed Monster and takes a small finger crack through a roof.
lines.location: Mixed - bolts and small trad gear.

lines.name: 30 years in the making
lines.description: Easy climbing to the crux move. Then reach the roof an go right to reach the belay anchor of reach for the sky.
lines.location: ~6 meters right of windy city from the ground.

lines.name: Fancy Dancer
lines.description: Rappel east (hiker's right) of Windy City to a hanging belay to climb this vertical route.

lines.name: Forgotten Dreams
lines.description: Rappel the same as and start at the same hanging belay as Windy City but head out left through a short crack to link up with the bottom of Fancy Dancer.

lines.name: Mr. Bojangles
lines.description: Rappel from the top of the cliff at the letters "Mr. B" to the hanging belay. Climb the bolted line straight up from the belay for a very nice ride.

lines.name: North Country Club Crack
lines.description: Rappel the same as Poochy but move left to belay at the left side of the ledge and climb the overhanging crack.

lines.name: Northern Delights
lines.description: Rappel at the point described in the area overview to a hanging belay and climb the corner past a couple of fixed pins before moving out right onto the black slab.

lines.name: On the Edge
lines.description: Rappel at the dihedral with the letters "Mr. B" painted at the top of the cliff to the hanging belay. Move right off the belay to the bolted arete.

lines.name: Open Project
lines.description: Open project with a very blank middle.

lines.name: Otis
lines.description: Rappel the same as Poochy but continue straight up after the 4th bolt to more face climbing.

lines.name: Poochy
lines.description: Rappel from the west (hiker's left) side of the lookout near a dead tree to the hanging belay. Start on the first 4 bolts of Otis before trending right and moving through the roof to the headwall before the anchors.

lines.name: Sculpted Cow
lines.description: Rappel from the cliff top at the painted letters "Mr. B" but go past the hanging belay to the ground. Start in a right-facing dihedral and move up the cliff. The FA did this in 3 pitches that went at 10a/7/10b with the pitch 1 and pitch 2 belays being off of ledges.

lines.name: Windy City
lines.description: Rappel a bit east (hiker's right) of the rappel for Poochy/Otis/NCCC to the hanging belay and climb up and right to the top of the cliff.

lines.name: Windy City from Ground
lines.description: Rappel past the Windy City hanging belay to the ground to add some more climbing without a change in grade.

lines.name: Above the Clouds
lines.description: The extension to Stratus Fear that bumps the difficulty a letter grade and takes the line all the way to the top.

lines.name: Aud Ball
lines.description: Move hiker's right from the rappel for Swashbuckler/Victor Mature/IWIWDIOJM and rappel to the hanging belay. Climb the short face.

lines.name: Buccaneer
lines.description: Rappel the same as Nimbus but rap further down to a lower hanging belay. Climb a technical face to a steeper finish. It's also possible to finish on Nimbus for the same grade of 10d.

lines.name: Fully Erect
lines.description: The free version of the aid line Homo Erectus.

lines.name: Homo Erectus
lines.description: Rappel through the hole at the top of the cliff and climb P1 (A1) to the belay stance where you climb the P2 (10c) crack and top out through the hole you rappelled in through.

lines.name: I Wish I Was Deep Instead of Just Macho
lines.description: Rappel the same as for Victor Mature/Swashbuckler and swing left to another hanging belay. Move up tricky pockets to the top of the cliff.

lines.name: Mulleteer
lines.description: Rappel the same as Buccaneer and use the same hanging belay but move left off the belay and clip painted hangers.

lines.name: Nimbus
lines.description: An excellent line with great exposure climbing up the lookout. Rappel just east (hiker's right) of the lookout to a hanging belay. If the seconding climber falls at the crux they can be stranded hopelessly in space.

lines.name: Renaissance Man
lines.description: Rappel through the hole to a hanging belay and climb the obvious crack.

lines.name: The Roaming Gypsies
lines.description: Rappel to the ground as for Maneline (or approach at the base). Pitch 1 starts in a dihedral on the west (climber's right) side of the Lion's Head lookout and ends at a ledge. Pitch 2 traverses far left to the top of the lookout.

lines.name: The Sick and the Afflicted
lines.description: Rappel 30 feet east (hiker's right) of Nimbus/Buccaneer/Mulleteer to another hanging belay and climb the vertical face with a steeper finish.

lines.name: Stratus Fear
lines.description: The obvious crack up the middle of the Lion's Head overhang. This route ends at the midpoint anchor while the extension Above the Clouds goes to the top.

lines.name: Swashbuckler
lines.description: Rappel down 15 feet east (hiker's right) of the hole and move to the the west (rappeller's right) of the arete to the hanging belay at a stance. Climb through a boulder problem to get to the arete.

lines.name: Victor Mature Lives
lines.description: Rappel as for Swashbuckler but stay east (rappeller's left) of the arete to a hanging belay. Climb up classic face climbing on thin holds.

lines.name: Anaesthesia
lines.description: Overgrown. Start up about 150 feet right of Time, the Avenger to climb the crack.

lines.name: Boiling a Dust Speck
lines.description: Overgrown. Near the far right end of the cliff, climb the crack to the top.

lines.name: Katrina and the Waves
lines.description: This route starts from the ground a couple hundred feet climber's right of the B-52 overhang and heads up the arete with technical movement.

lines.name: Medalta
lines.description: Starts up just right of Katrina off of a ledge to move up the face.

lines.name: North Shore
lines.description: This route starts from the ground but can be identified by the letters NS on top of the cliff. Face climbing without bolts.

lines.name: Time the Avenger
lines.description: Overgrown. Start about 200 feet right of Transition or Transgression to go up a thin crack through an overhang.

lines.name: Transition or Transgression
lines.description: Start from the ground and layback your way to some hard movement.

lines.name: Twenty Feet in Tennessee
lines.description: Overgrown. Climb the roof at the far right side of the cliff. This is the rightmost route at Lion's Head.

lines.name: You Sweaty Hippy
lines.description: Another face climb that starts from the ground, might be a bit reachy.

lines.name: Howg's is M'Favorit Critters
lines.description: The first route right of the rappel corner, climb the face with a weird move down low.

lines.name: Looks Can Be Deceiving
lines.description: Just left of the rappel corner, top rope this face.

lines.name: Pigme
lines.description: Climb thin holds up the vert face.

lines.name: Pigroast
lines.description: Right of Howg's is this interesting route.

lines.name: Project
lines.description: Partially bolted line up the arete just right of the ledge.

lines.name: Gin and Juice
lines.description: Rappel down just to the left of the ledge to the hanging belay and follow the leftward trending line of bolts to end straight up the face.

lines.name: Laid Back
lines.description: Rappel the same as for Gin and Juice to the hanging belay just left of the ledge and climb straight up after the first bolt, plugging gear along the way.

lines.name: The Lighthouse Pitch
lines.description: Use the same start as Thunderball but trend further right through some huecos before moving up a right facing dihedral.

lines.name: Storm Warning
lines.description: A very nice trad line, this one starts in the dihedral at the right side of the ledge to gain the ledge itself. The second pitch takes the leftward trending crack to the top, ending a bit left of Tricks are for Kids. The first pitch is the money pitch and climbing one of the other routes to the top from the ledge is probably best.

lines.name: Thunderball
lines.description: This fantastic gear line is a great option for a second pitch to Storm Warning. Step off the right side of the ledge and pull an exciting roof, continuing up slinging threads and placing gear to the top.

lines.name: Tom's Lucky Bun-Day
lines.description: This is the leftmost line on the ledge and climbs through long movement to the top.

lines.name: Tricks are for Kids
lines.description: This excellent sport route starts in the center of the ledge and climbs nice pockets to the top.  It starts beneath a thread.

lines.name: Summer Residence
lines.description: Starts in a corner where you can stem and lay back on side crimps for 4 bolts (2-3 & 3-4 are slightly run out), then turns into an overhand with generally juggy holds. Bolt #5 is run out but it is just before pulling the crux of the climb. You then come around under the roof onto an awkward block. Come out into the upper corner, clip above the roof, then easy slabby climbing to the top (7th bolt halfway up). The bolting is spread out on this route. Fun climbing, but eases up severely after coming out from under and around the roof. Expect big falls on the 3rd, 4th, and 5th clips... Missing the 3rd may result in a ground fall. You shouldn't be concerned about the 6th or 7th clip as you've already pulled the crux at this point. The slabby climbing on the upper section is very gentle.

lines.name: Albatross
lines.description: Rappel in just to the west (hiker's left) of a corner filled with some loose rock.

lines.name: Czar
lines.description: Probably the best route on the cliff, rappel just east (hiker's right) of the cedar trees to a 3-bolt hanging belay. Move left from the belay and then straight up to the top.

lines.name: Electric Avenue
lines.description: Start at the same hanging belay as fuse box but climb the left bolt line on more pockets.

lines.name: Fuse Box
lines.description: Rappel just west (hiker's right) of the trees at the edge of the cliff to the hanging belay and take the right bolt line up through a line of pockets.

lines.name: Laputa
lines.description: Rappel just east (hiker's right) of Czar to a lower hanging belay than that of Czar to climb this very nice long route.

lines.name: Project
lines.description: Project

lines.name: Short Circuit
lines.description: Rappel to a hanging belay from a lower area of the top of the cliff. Might have some loose rock.

lines.name: Swept Away
lines.description: Rappel near some dead trees to the hanging belay and move left before moving back right to a seam to the top.

lines.name: Wired
lines.description: Rappel at the furthest west (hiker's left) point before the cliff drops down a bit. Climb up and right then straight up the wall.

lines.name: Bat Man
lines.description: Spectacular line. Start as if for Dr. Zeaus but move left at the fourth bolt into excellent face climbing before heading up the huge overhang. Jump off at the top after pulling the roof.

lines.name: Dr Zeaus
lines.description: Start up about 20 feet left of Drunken Master; head right after the second bolt.

lines.name: Drunken Master
lines.description: Start on the steep left side of the wall and climb up to a hard boulder problem to climb another full 35m line.

lines.name: Far From the Maddening Crowd
lines.description: An excellent line, rappel at the letters FFMC painted at the top of the cliff to a hanging belay. Climb the face at the start to large holds at the top.

lines.name: Hotel Bennell
lines.description: This link-up combines the bottom of Titan with the top of The Man in Me to create this difficult line. Traverse over after pulling the lip on Titan. This is tougher than Titan but is also given 14a.

lines.name: Lion's Head Express
lines.description: One of the hardest lines at Lion's Head, start up about 30 feet left of Bat Man to go up this fantastic climb. Some of the holds might be very sharp. Jump off after climbing a bit past the last bolt.

lines.name: Living on the Edge
lines.description: Start on Drunken Master but head left after its crux to climb through exposed terrain over the massive roof of Bat Man.

lines.name: The Man in Me
lines.description: An excellent technical line, this starts 10 feet to the left of Titan and climbs 35m to the top.

lines.name: Maxi Pista
lines.description: A great line that starts 15 feet left of Lion's Head Express, this line moves through multiple cruxes including one using a very small edge.

lines.name: Mini Me
lines.description: Another link-up that's backwards of Hotel Bennell, start on Man in Me and traverse just after the roof to the upper part of Titan.

lines.name: Road to No Depression
lines.description: Start the same as for Dr. Zeaus but continue up the dihedral after the second bolt.

lines.name: Titan
lines.description: One of the harder climbs at Lion's Head, thin face moves lead to more varied climbing and a difficult crux. Climbing to the midpoint anchor is 5.13d and the climbing from there is 5.13b from the hanging belay.

lines.name: Waveguiding
lines.description: Just left of the dihedral next to Man in Me, start up this long adventurous route.

lines.name: [Redacted]
lines.description: Sloppy Pussy

lines.name: Bow and Arrow
lines.description: Start by climbing an easy crack system with varied gear to a bulge.  Surmount the bulge directly or bypass the difficulties to the right on easier terrain.  Either way puts you at a stance below an imposing overhang.  Clip a bolt (the only one on the route), and make a long reach to gain the flake above.  Continue enjoyably up the steep flake to a stance, then climb up and right to the chains.
lines.location: This route is located 25 meters to the right of Matt's Route.  It is easily identified by the large overhang with a beatiful flake.
lines.protection: Standard rack up to #3 camalot.  Save a #1 for the flake, as I couldn't get anything else to fit.

lines.name: Caesar Salad
lines.description: Overhanging climbing to a dihedral, then more overhang to the anchors.

lines.name: Desperado
lines.description: This route makes more sense as a single pitch, but there is a difficult move at 2/3 height directly above a ledge.  For that reason (as far as I can tell), there are anchors on the ledge so you can safely commit to the move off the ledge.  Scramble easily up the slab, clipping a couple of bolts before the handholds get smaller and the feet disappear.  Delicately make your way up the next 3 meters before the climbing eases off and you can scramble to the ledge.  Either stop here to belay, or continue up and left towards the upper dihedral.  Fun climbing on steep rock past a few more bolts will deposit you at the anchors.
lines.location: The bolted slab 75 meters right of the Seamstress.
lines.protection: Quickdraws, plus a long sling for the intermediate anchors if doing as one pitch.

lines.name: Johnson
lines.description: From the start, climb up a series of horizontal and vertical cracks ranging from finger to fist sized. Chains are located on the face right of a vertical crack.
lines.location: Start is hidden behind some trees climbers right of Squirmish and left of Caesar Salad. The chains are easily identifiable from the top and can be top roped (use your own gear).

lines.name: Pandemic Isolation
lines.description: Crux is low at the start with a second crux after the 4th bolt.
lines.location: Climbers right of "warm up 11a" start in dihedral to the left of the arete at the end of this portion of the wall.
lines.protection: 7 bolts plus anchors.Update: bolts have been chopped as of April 2021. Only anchors.

lines.name: Pandemic Restriction
lines.description: Route starts over water. Anchors installed for comfortable hanging belay. first bolt requires stick clip for safety. We don't want the climber falling in the water. 7 bolts plus anchors. Equipped  05/30/2020 Large log moved into position under the start to avoid having to Rappel into the route or wade in the water. 06/04/2020
lines.location: from the southern edge of the crag, follow the shoreline north to the end  of the first accessible wall just past "seamstress". At this point walk on a log to reach the belay station equipped with anchors for a comfortable stance.

lines.name: Pandemic Solution
lines.description: Should be a classic once it’s cleaned and seen some action. Recommend the use of an alpine draw on the hanger below the perma-draw to reduce rope drag.
lines.location: Starts on the very end of the log anchored below the wall.
lines.protection: 8 hangers, 1 perma-draw, anchors at the top.

lines.name: Pockets are Good
lines.description: The first half of this route is called Crackers (5.7 PG). It is protected with traditional gear which is good through the crux. The second half is correct (Pockets are Good, sport climb) but had an original grade of 5.9. If you don't have a trad rack then you can reach Pockets are Good by climbing the first pitch of Desperado.
lines.location: Starts a few meters right of Desperado below a very shallow left facing corner.

lines.name: Seamstress
lines.description: One of Ontario's best 5.12's.   crack, to overhang to slab climbing.    Packs a punch.
lines.protection: 10 bolts & anchors. as of 2016 the anchors on this route are rendered unusable. (Needs retrobolting)  New anchor rings installed as of June 4, 2020

lines.name: Squirmish
lines.description: Start on the right crack and follow to a ledge, climb a slightly overhung ledge to gain the first bolt, follow a rail up to the second bolt and place gear as you climb through the off-width to the anchors.
lines.location: Shares the start with Bow and Arrow but moves right at the overhang.
lines.protection: Mixed gear, standard Ontario trad rack to 3", couple of sport draws for the bolts, alpine draw might reduce rope drag.

lines.name: This is what you want, this is what you get
lines.description: Start just right of the drip on good rock, move upwards on good rock cracks until it's possible to traverse left onto the hanging ice drip. The crux of the route will be moving from the rock onto the ice face. The mixed climbing might be bypassed by a talented (i.e. - skinny pillars) ice climber, or if conditions allow ice to form to the base.
lines.location: Shares a start with the trad route "Johnson (5.9)"; which is on the adjacent wall, climbers right of "Squirmish (5.11-)".
lines.protection: Standard trad rack to 3", standard ice rack.

lines.name: The Warm Up
lines.description: While this isn't a warmup for most, it's definitely a classic.  This route has a lot to offer: tricky face moves, juggy overhangs, and some spicy sections to keep you on your toes.  Getting to the high first bolt requires difficult climbing above a bad landing.  Consider a stick clip.  Start atop a boulder and make your way left with an interesting sequence below a roof.  Pull the small roof at it's left side to easier climbing up a quartzy dihedral.  A mantle move and a few bolts later, you'll find yourself below a larger roof.  Continue up through the roof, and establish yourself on the face above (crux).  The hard climbing is over, so gun it for the chains before the pump clock runs out!!  If you blow it here, you'll be going for a ride!
lines.location: 20 meters right of the Seamstress below a section of golden rock with orange lichen.

lines.name: Lucky Number 13
lines.description: Great climbing to a high foot crux on two crimps, obvious from the closely spaced bolts and clear crux bolt at your waist.  Pull hard to a jug.  13-14 Draws.

lines.name: Polish Warmup
lines.description: One of the best 10's at Metcalfe, solid for the grade and a little run out on good holds.
lines.location: Start left of Rigor Mortis and follow bolts through crack systems.

lines.name: Jug City
lines.description: In the corridor to climber's right if they are facing Good Fethas in the Metcalfe North area.Route is at the far end of the corridor on the left side if approaching from the anvil.

lines.name: Pump it Hottie, Pump it
lines.description: Shares the start with 'Revenge for the Fires'. Follows the bolt line on the right after the 2nd bolt.
lines.location: Slab start to the right of the overhang that forms the 'anvil". Left of the gully trial

lines.name: Strike Three
lines.description: The only route on the main cliff wall, towards the back where there is a bend in the climber's corridor and it splits off to where pigeons hang out.
lines.location: 6 bolts to chains. The top bolt hanger is missing, creating a small run-out to anchors over very easy terrain.

lines.name: Forearms on Stun
lines.description: First bolt is like 35 ft up so I don't think this is sport.

lines.name: Full Metal Jacket
lines.description: Short route with a crux around the second bolt off of a low left sidepull.

lines.name: It's Not Everyday
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: When I Put My Helmet On I Become Like Superman
lines.description: Crack line of epic proportions,  an easy start and a few pieces of gear will get you to the first bolt.  Solid laybacks to the small bulge traverse right on some crimps and smears to a decent rest and hold it together on a few pinches and pockets to the anchor.

lines.name: Zen Garden
lines.description: Classic 5.10, arete slapping, mega crimping climb.  Anchors on this climb were a botch job. Left bolt is loose and the quick link attached to it doesn't provide enough clearance to lower without very severe rope dragging.  Safer to rappel from this one, due to its steep nature and much easier to clean this way too.

lines.name: Annika Sorenstam
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: My Preciousness
lines.description: Good limestone rock route that traverses to the left. Some footholds broke in the first third of the route making it maybe a little more stiff.This Route is Knock Down, already entered in the system.  Wongs guidebook is wildly inaccurate and this should be removed.
lines.location: The route is around the gully area of Golf Town, at the end of Metcalfe. The area is called in a guidebook 'The Land Before Time'

lines.name: Called Out
lines.description: First bolted line on the ledge to the left of the ground-level belay station. Start to the left of the bolted line and moves up and right. Can be started from the crack with the tree but makes the start much harder. Shares the 5th bolt and anchors with 'Just a 5.6'
lines.location: Walk the gully trail to the left from the bridge. Look for the climbers trail that heads up the cliff to a small ledge just to the left of the ground-level belay station.

lines.name: Just a 5.6
lines.description: Located on the same ledge as, but to the climbers left of, 'Called Out'. Shares the 5th bolt and anchors with 'Called Out'.

lines.name: El Camino Real
lines.description: Ultra classic trad line. Bring wide gear.

lines.name: Good Featha's
lines.description: Pumpy start on overhang leads to a good rest and then progressively easier climbing above. The bouldery start is more difficult since some holds broke off.

lines.name: Peak Season In Harlem
lines.description: This route has some tough moves down low but then eases up a bit around the third or fourth bolt. Mostly jugs up to the very top and then one hard move again at the anchors.

lines.name: Phoenix
lines.description: Starts roughly in the same crack/corner as With Boots before heading onto the left face under a bulge. Has a similar end to Peak Season in Harlem, though of lesser quality overall.
lines.location: Climbers right of Peak Season in Harlem, just left of the crack system.

lines.name: De je View
lines.description: This route is hardest getting through the first three bolts on overhanging rock. This section will probably be easiest if you stay right. Enjoy easier climbing above until you reach a shelf of sloped grips. Easy from there again through the anchors.

lines.name: Decade
lines.description: Should almost be given a V-grade! Funky start moves gain a shake, then slap your way through the bouldery crux and cruise long moves on good holds to anchors.
lines.location: Immediately left of 'Harry's Climb' 5.12a and right of 'Mother of Jam' 5.6

lines.name: White Hand
lines.description: This overhanging dihedral/ crack line is often overlooked for its neighbouring Vox but is not to be missed.  A few easier moves off the ground gain you a thin crack.  Start locking those fingers (taping will help), and good footwork will help you stave off the pump longer for the top section.  Climbs like a trad route more than a sport.  Crack takes good gear along the way if you're looking for a 12 range trad route.

lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: WHMIS
lines.description: Trend left for the first twenty or so feet to get over the bulge and then follow the crack up to the top.
