lines.name: Jenny's crack
lines.description: This is the obvious crack just north on of Six Mile Marina on the north side of the peninsula.      We heard the name of the crack was called Jenny's crack from previous Top rope attempts.      Comes straight out of the water, but there is a nice ledge at the bottom where you can belay.
lines.location: This is the obvious crack just north on of Six Mile Marina on the north side of the peninsula.
lines.protection: Takes larger cams (#1 and #2) for the bottom roof section.  Smaller stuff up top.  2 bolts at the top belay.

lines.name: Air Jamaica
lines.description: A classic Oates route.  Steep and bulging, densely packed with hard moves like a Chinese cemetery.

lines.name: High Times
lines.description: Crank up some powerful moves at the roof near the start, quickly mellows out to a fun finish afterwards.

lines.name: Impact Zone
lines.description: Work through a roof using a crack in the wall to gain a roof, then another.  keep pulling hard on some steep rock and chains.

lines.name: Ira Mahn
lines.description: Classic climbing up steep bulges, thugy and technical.  Stick clip or die falling into a hole.

lines.name: Jello on a Spring
lines.description: Make a series of funky moves up the face to the bulging roof.  A broken hold will make you feel like you've been hit with a sandbag.  The roof move favours the taller, while shorter climbers will feel as if they are grasping at straws. Pull your way through and gain some easier finishing moves.

lines.name: Mahseeve Cool
lines.description: Classic Baldy sandbag.  Crank through some steep overhanging moves off the ground (crux moves) to gain a ledge.  Take a rest and enjoy the view, keep pulling some overhangs on typical Baldy-esque pockets to gain another large ledge, clip the bolt and rest again before tackling the last 15 feet of rock to the chain.

lines.name: Napoleon Complex
lines.description: Named after Mike Smythe.  Short but full of attitude. You'll need to fight for this one, right to the very end.

lines.name: Renaissance Man
lines.description: Like a renaissance man/woman, you'll need to pull out your many talents to send this long route. Great movement with 4 district areas of climbing separated by rests. The best route on the Air Jamaica wall.

lines.name: Solid Goldie
lines.description: Stick clip the first bolt. New route put up March 31, 2012. Follow the obvious crack to a shelf and big throw. Nice movement to a large flake. No hands rest before the crux. Pull the lip to top out! Burly!  In memory of Bill Goldie (1952 - 2012) and his work putting up traditional routes at Baldy years ago.

lines.name: Traverse Route
lines.description: Follow the layback flake to the bulge. Go left around it and a cedar tree, then continue up the face to anchors.

lines.name: Gridlock
lines.description: Good warmup. The face towards the bottom eases up more to jugs at the top. Jugs may be filled with water if it has rained lately.

lines.name: Indigo Girl
lines.description: Crux is down low and eases up a bit as you get higher.

lines.name: Jagged Edge
lines.description: Big moves on good holds.  Some small moves with sequencing.  Another...sandbagged Baldy route.

lines.name: Look Moe, a Poifect Coicle
lines.description: Crux is down low. There is risk of swinging on falls.
lines.location: South end of the Alley, under overhanging rock.

lines.name: Neo Nautilus
lines.description: Pockets galore, but don't get your hopes up, they aren't that great.  Pull through them on some spaced bolts, and one particularly far gone bolt.

lines.name: Optical Delusion
lines.description: A medium route in the middle of The Alley.  Some of the holds seemed slippery and dirty.
lines.location: Third route from the Left or Right on the cliff side of The Alley.

lines.name: Pins & Needles
lines.description: Long moves of decent holds, boulder around your local gym before getting on this one.

lines.name: Return of the Jingoid
lines.description: Short route doesn't look like much, but actually pretty enjoyable.
lines.location: The first route on the pinnacle side of the alley on the right.

lines.name: Salieri's Revenge
lines.description: A few crux's and sustained from start to finish.
lines.location: Last route on the pinnacle inside The Alley.

lines.name: Sneakers and Roids
lines.description: Follow the left line of bolts from a boulder stack.
lines.location: Right side of the alley, very close to the Change Guy.

lines.name: Split Leggings
lines.description: Great route some tricky moves but easy to read.  Tricky traverse right to start.  Crux at top with 2 crimps.
lines.location: Left of the entrance to The Alley.  Is the left most sport route for a little bit.

lines.name: Troglodyte Delight
lines.description: Climb the obvious right leaning crack system until you reach a small cave. Watch out that you don’t kick some of the choss in the cave onto you belayer and continue up the left side of the cave to the bolts

lines.name: Undomesticated
lines.description: Great climb if your a solid 11 climber, some spaced bolting will make it heady otherwise.  Crux moves off the ground and a few great moves on the overhanging headwall.
lines.location: Easy toprope access from Split Leggings.  Don't climb off the cold shuts, use your own gear.

lines.name: Who's That Change Guy
lines.description: Follow the right set of bolts. Traverse right and head up on jugs.
lines.location: Towards the right side of the Alley.

lines.name: The Anniversary
lines.description: Follow crack line right of French Revolution.  Place some gear at the end of it and keep it together for the rest of the non protected face.  Blow it and risk groundfall.

lines.name: Black Magic Woman
lines.description: Thin crack system left of French Revolution. One bolt and some protection will get you to the top. Just left of the very obvious crack system.

lines.name: Cobra
lines.description: Similar is style to it's counterpart Frenzy, only smaller and more technical holds.

lines.name: Conan
lines.description: A great climbing following a left facing crack system. Solid layback climbing. Unique climb different from any other climb at Baldy. Classic!

lines.name: French Revolution
lines.description: Climb overhanging face past bolts and two pitons to anchors. Tricky Crux!

lines.name: Frenzy
lines.description: technical face climbing with a redpoint crux before the anchors.  Small holds but good feet aplenty,

lines.name: Larry
lines.description: Climb the chimney to a hand crack up to a cedar to an easier finish.
lines.location: Obvious corner in Black Forest Wall

lines.name: The Stung
lines.description: A must do for a 5.10 trad climber.  Nice jamming through cruxes and a few fun steep moves in the upper bit.  It now has anchors.

lines.name: Unplucked Gems
lines.description: "It's hard to say, it's sad but true. I'm kinda dumb and so are you."  Easy moves lead to a boulder problem in the sky
lines.location: Climbs direct along the bolt line right of Frenzy.

lines.name: A Shot Across the Bow
lines.description: Old baldy CLASSIC.  Incredibly hard moves off the boulder rock field.  Crank like all hell up the first couple of moves and start working up the arete while it gets steeper.   Stick clip the first bolt if you like living, otherwise take your chances falling into the abyss.

lines.name: Amadeus Rocks
lines.description: Good fun climbing to a crux before the anchors.   Solid 12, or cockroach to the arete on the left and make it an 11a.    Classic position either way you do it, puts on a great show for the tourists who will think your the coolest person around.  (Which you are)

lines.name: Bear on a Wire
lines.description: Short and Stout, great for boulderers and gym climbers. high first bolt and an inobvious move up high might have you falling back to reality.

lines.name: Elixir
lines.description: This is what it's all about, steep bulging rock and a stack of boulder problems.  A chew you up and spit you off crux awaits you.  All that training finally pays off when you reach the chains on this drink.

lines.name: Beaver Fever
lines.description: A low crux guards some of the best 10B climbing at baldy.    Stick clip the first bolt or bring a .75 cam to protect the start.
lines.location: bolts and anchors (0.75 cam if you please)

lines.name: Dyno Route
lines.description: It is what it is.  Throw amongst solution holds to link together the route.  Look for a glue in and that's your crux.

lines.name: Entropy
lines.description: Start up in the black streak on some easy holds, a definitive crux at a small bulge hits like a brick.  Exposed and cool headwall is only mildly less difficult.

lines.name: Where's Waldo
lines.description: Do This Route.  Beware the detached flake that has now teetered a few feet from the wall (it used to be a few inches).  A problem roof into a small dihedral and a whole lot of great moves and exposure.  There is a move up top that tends to chew up and spit out those seeking onsights. Be wary.

lines.name: Bagger's Jig
lines.description: Yet another sandbag on the crystal-like slippery holds of Baldy.  Keep it together for the sucker move.

lines.name: Crystalline
lines.description: Great climb if you love getting sandbagged, like most at baldy. Bring your headgame and prepare the crank harder than you've ever pulled on an 11C.

lines.name: Labour Pains
lines.description: Prolonged difficult climbing on some of the best rock around, crux at the bulge will have you fully contracted for a big move to a jug.

lines.name: Laplacian Ballroom
lines.description: Goes between slab to pockets with slight overhangs.  There are 2 very tricky sequences near the middle-top.  Where you need to figure out the right sequence to get through intermediates.  There are interesting fossils in the rock.
lines.location: This is the left most route in the area.  To the direct left of a ledge with roots.

lines.name: Cemetery Polka
lines.description: Start on Exit Stage Right and follow the left bolt line to a few hard moves and anchors.

lines.name: Death by Lougin
lines.description: Climb the technical arete to a shelf and a good shake out. Clip the fourth bolt as you enter the second crux and power through the fun moves to the anchors.
lines.location: Located just right of Scimitar and climbs the arete

lines.name: Exit Stage Right
lines.description: Kind of a sandbag for a 10B.  Since initially put up some holds have crumbled over the years.  Sustained for the grade.

lines.name: Penner for Your Thoughts
lines.description: Surmount a slabby face and traverse around a roof and crank through the next one.

lines.name: Scimitar
lines.description: An awesome arete up high is protected by some cryptic climbing... and an incredibly high first bolt requiring some gear or a huge stick clip.

lines.name: Sweet Jane
lines.description: Easy climbing on pretty chossy rock in terms of protection.
lines.location: Obvious crack to climbers right (south of) of the entrance of the North Pinnacle.

lines.name: Wild Dogs
lines.description: In the gully of the Scimitar Pinnacle. Enjoyable climbing out of a chimney that leads onto an arete with a few killer moves before the end.

lines.name: Wild Thing
lines.description: An old traditional route, done by linking Penner for Your Thoughts into Death by Lougin.  Retrobolted into a sport route.

lines.name: Bionic Spaceboy
lines.description: Height dependant, one move wonder. Don't get your hopes up on this one.

lines.name: Blood n Valour
lines.description: A good route pretty standard 5.8 climbing.  Start was the crux.
lines.location: The first route you see after descending the trail

lines.name: Christina's World
lines.description: David Smart classic, no longer needs gear to get an ascent. Just godly strength.

lines.name: Climb Hard or Take In a Show
lines.description: Crux is low and a miss at the first two bolts may result in ground fall.

lines.name: Domestic Pressure
lines.description: Slabby at start but gets more steep and difficult. Traverse left after the third bolt instead of heading straight up.

lines.name: Domestic Pressure Direct
lines.description: Slabby at start but gets more steep and difficult. Continue straight up after the third bolt instead of taking the traverse.
lines.location: In the gully on the left.

lines.name: Fallout
lines.description: The crux is cranking the roof. Get over that and continue over some milder overhang to anchors.
lines.location: Starts quite left of Domestic Pressure, but shares its anchors and the last 2 bolts.

lines.name: Lougins Go to the Ballet
lines.description: Just over from Resplendence.  Shared first bolt with Bionic Spaceboy then move right to a cave.  To the mid route anchors is 11B, the full extension is 12A.

lines.name: Rabid Grannies
lines.description: Very hard between first and second bolt then progressively gets easier.
lines.location: The second route a bit to the left of Blood n Valour.

lines.name: Tiny Bubbles
lines.description: Pulling the final roof is the hardest part.  But it is not over when you get to the vertical climbing.
lines.location: The obvious roof on the south pinnacle.  This is the sport route that goes to the left.  There is a harder route that goes right.

lines.name: Sink the Pink
lines.description: Kind of sketchy to fall on but really easy climbing. You can jump off the top into the water. A large tree near the top can be used to top rope this route.
lines.location: To the right of the pink rock, traverse from the right and go up the slabby face.
lines.protection: Water but there's some rocks sticking out.

lines.name: Mr Goose Direct
lines.description: Direct vertical line to the right of the bush. Start either on the lowest prominent jug or pull out of the water for slightly more challenge. It's not cleaned and is fairly dirty.
lines.location: See photo. Directly right of the bush.

lines.name: Mr Gooses Wild Ride
lines.description: Pull out of the water near the right of the formation and traverse left then climb up right of the bush.

lines.name: Center Left
lines.description: A little harder than Left Light.

lines.name: Center Right
lines.description: Finishes at the jug below the 3rd light.
lines.location: 3rd light from the left, or, Center Right light.

lines.name: Finger Lock
lines.description: The only problem here with a finger jam.
lines.location: spot the small crack, where the mortar fell out, between the the two right lights.

lines.name: Jack's Arete
lines.description: Climbs to the left of the left-most light up to the ledge using the cornerstones. Named for Jack Stewart who worked at the jail for many years when it still held inmates.

lines.name: Left Light
lines.description: Finishes under the left most light.

lines.name: Bio Terror
lines.description: Thin crimping leads to a rest before some pocket pulling and a finishing crux.

lines.name: Guantanamo Bay
lines.description: Tech corner leads to a compression crux and anchors.

lines.name: Osama Bin Laden
lines.description: Minimal sized pockets and fancy footwork lead to the upper section of this route.

lines.name: Poison Gas
lines.description: Powerful roof pulling and solid 11b all the way through. Longer than it looks, pack extra draws.  (Roof is missing 3 holds that were pulled off, the grade has been bumped substantially and lowered its quality.)

lines.name: Saddam Hussein
lines.description: Cryptic route opener into straightforward sending and a solid crux.

lines.name: Sleeper Cell
lines.description: Two crux's at bottom and top protect anchors, solve the sequence and save some for the end.

lines.name: Taliban
lines.description: Solid enigmatic climbing, originally 10c.  Very sequence dependent.

lines.name: Weapons of Mass Destruction
lines.description: A boulder problem off the start feeds into easier pulling with a runout to finish off.

lines.name: Daisy Cutter
lines.description: A harder start on an arete with some reachy holds with good rests along the way and some great movement.  While off the beaten path, it makes for a great day out along with a few other area gems.

lines.name: Definitely not a 5.6
lines.description: Great route, shitty rock.

lines.name: A Division of Sabre
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Half Grade Diamond
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Osama Sleeps With Sharknado
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Unleash the Power of the Pyramid
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Castles in the Sand
lines.description: Stick clip recommended as the crux is down low. After sticking the crux, make a couple delicate moves past the first bolt, the climbing gets easier from here. Slab styles moves with pockets bring you to a small ledge, using a finger crack on your right and some small holds on the left you can head straight up to the anchors or venture in to the corner on the right for a slightly easier although dirtier finish.
lines.location: First bolted line on the wall.

lines.name: Crack of Time
lines.description: Start the same as Lichen and Vitamin D, then trend right to a small birch tree halfway up the wall. Move left around the tree to enter a left trending finger crack that eventually turns back to the right. Once back in line with the tree climb straight up on face holds to top out.
lines.location: Same start as Lichen and Vitamin D
lines.protection: Trad, BD .3 to #2 with option for some nuts. Shared anchor

lines.name: Just What the Doctor Ordered
lines.description: Get your slab game on, crux is between 2nd and 3rd bolts. Some cool little features on this route
lines.location: Currently the furthest right bolted line at The Sandbox

lines.name: Lichen and Vitamin D
lines.description: Start on some small flakes and blocky holds and move up to a significant horizontal seam. Pull past the seam and on to the upper slab with a varying fingers+/- crack that thins out near the top. Move slightly left to top out. (Shares bolted anchor with Crack of Time.)
lines.location: First established route on The Sandbox wall
lines.protection: Trad, mostly small gear (finger and smaller) with option of #1 or #2 at horizontal seam. Shared bolted anchor.

name: Red Rock Mountain (aka Pet Wall, Pet Rock, Red Rock)

lines.name: Bashi-Bazouk
lines.description: Sit start with feet to the left, hands matched in waist-high crack. Switch feet to right, left jug straight up. Side pull right on good edge, foot up on ledge, finish on jug about 10 ft up.  Landing is sketchy (sloping ground and rocks, very small), topping out not recommended. Some holds broke during climbing but the ones on this boulder should be good now.
lines.location: Short face with small landing on the southern end of the cliff.

lines.name: Banana Pancakes
lines.description: Lower down until the last ledge, and then do about 20 feet of face/slab climbing to another small ledge and then finish the climb with a finger crack (the crux). There are plenty of footholds around the finger crack, but it is more fun to just send the crack to top out.
lines.location: Set a top rope on the furthest set of bolts to the left on the main cliff (these bolts are actually separated from the main cliff, but are still part of the main section).

lines.name: The Ryan Rooks Experience
lines.description: Pull a tricky roof and climb the sustained face to the top. The roof/bulge pull is the crux, but the vertical face climbing is pretty consistent.
lines.location: When facing out towards the water from the top of the cliff, locate the furthest left set of bolt anchors. This climb starts below the relatively obvious roof bulge below.

lines.name: Dandy Blend Coffee Substitute
lines.description: Start with undercling at chest height and the pocket in the crack at face height. Follow the crack up and over the lip.

lines.name: Golden Latte
lines.description: Climb up the dihedral.

lines.name: Kefir and Cereal
lines.description: Walk up the slab without using either arête. Top out between the two notches.

lines.name: Milk and Cereal
lines.description: Obvious easiest way up and down.

lines.name: Over Easy
lines.description: Up the steep side of the arête.

lines.name: Sunnyside Up
lines.description: Up the steep side of the arête.

lines.name: Vanilla Smoothie
lines.description: Same start as Milk and Cereal, continue straight up the juggy slab.

lines.name: Amazon Zombie Jail
lines.description: Good crack with better pro. Usually damp. Fall is best for gully routes.

lines.name: Creature from the Black Lagoon
lines.description: Slab to steep crux with not great pro.

lines.name: Forbidden Planet
lines.description: Techinical start leads into easier climbing.      Its location is much cooler than the climb itself.

lines.name: Mars Needs Women
lines.description: Seepage on a layback.

lines.name: Boom Shot
lines.description: Start on the mossy slab then climb the face above.

lines.name: Chained Heat
lines.description: Start as per The Fat Cobra or Liquid Plumber.  Once at the ledge, clip the fixed draw and plow through the boulder problem on the overhang.

lines.name: Cool Runnings
lines.description: Boulder your way up the beginning on black rock.  There is a slab section and crux before the anchors.

lines.name: The Fat Cobra
lines.description: Get on this thing. a beast of a route with every kind of move and a textbook photo finish.

lines.name: Ferratagate
lines.description: Shares start with Snakes and Ladders and trends Left.

lines.name: Gigajoule
lines.description: Highly rated climb that requires a full repertoire  of skill, Fist Jams, roof pulling and balance finish.
lines.location: Right most climb on the Big Boy Wall

lines.name: Johnny Drama
lines.description: Hard crimping to start on a high first bolt.  Dynamic movements get you to a bulge.  Go right around the bulge to another crux.  Easy finish with a view.

lines.name: KPI
lines.description: 12d if you ride it to the small cave and 13c/d if you take on the ensuing headwall above.  A V8 boulder problem guards some easier terrain until you reach the headwall and realize your too short to reach the spaced out holds.

lines.name: Left Hand of God
lines.description: Cries out to be climbed. Kind of like Liquid Plumber.  Just more splitter and go left instead of right.

lines.name: Liquid Plumber
lines.description: A thin crack that goes right. Can be linked into Chained Heat with the use of thin gear and some finger strength.

lines.name: Mac Attack
lines.description: Full value, Hard third clip and pumpy to the top

lines.name: Megatech (Project)
lines.description: DIrect start to Nanotech. Bouldery.

lines.name: Nanotech
lines.description: Start on the left corner which travels right.  Varied movements on difficult to see holds will make you feel hopeless.  Find the sequence and pull past the crux to a better section of jugs.  One last set of hard moves awaits you before clipping the chains.

lines.name: OB-1
lines.description: Difficult start with a sequence, miss it and get sandbagged. Easier climbing up top is guarded by a low crux.

lines.name: Pacing the Cage
lines.description: Bouldery start on hard moves gets easier the higher you get, pace yourself and save a little for a redpoint crux before the chains.

lines.name: Polynesian Town
lines.description: Climb the corner then move onto the slab and then face higher up.

lines.name: Project
lines.description: Anchors are in a loose block. Avoid until they are moved.

lines.name: Project
lines.description: Needs new bolt at crux.  Low percentage throw to a pocket will have you second guessing a fall on this manky bolt.

lines.name: Project
lines.description: No starting holds and a critical loose hold up high.

lines.name: Rookie Flair
lines.description: Alternative start to Cool Runnings, good for when the start of CR perpetually seeps.

lines.name: Shirts Off Posse (S.O.P)
lines.description: Steep awkward pockets to crank all the way through, a stiff 10C.  There is a hold on the right side that will alleviate the potential to be sadbagged.

lines.name: Snakes and Ladders
lines.description: Shares start with Ferratagate but splits right. Easy climbing gets more difficult near the top.

lines.name: Sumatra
lines.description: Epic line, stand in awe at the monumental task ahead on some great rock.  Start on the crack of LHOG and trend right.  Reach a bulge and do some hard moves, technical finish will keep you in the zone.

lines.name: Three Day Road
lines.description: Right veering crack systems. Good protection.

lines.name: U-Pak U-Suk
lines.description: Cockroach line for OB-1, may seem like a sandbag if you miss the hold/move. Perplexing for a 10b.

lines.name: Wish-A-Grip (Project)
lines.description: Big blank section of nothing.

lines.name: Flashdance
lines.description: Rock on the bottom is usually damp and moist. Make sure to stick clip. Be careful of the rock flaking off and make sure the belayer is  Crux is an undercling where the rock protrudes.

lines.name: La Tache
lines.description: "Located in a small clearing with 2 routes, this is the bolted route on the left side. Step onto a small ledge and up a short arete on the right. Sustained climbing on good holds. Belayers, be attentive of climbers moving to the second bolt." (from Ontario Rock Climbing: The Best of Southern Ontario guidebook)

lines.name: Mr. Pleasure
lines.description: Hard opening sequence leads to exposed steep finish

lines.name: Sunday Sausage
lines.description: Fun route that is unfortunately short.    Loose/Hollow rock above anchors.
lines.location: First climb on the wall on climbers right.

lines.name: Thunder Bunny
lines.description: "Start on a ledge/shallow cave and work your way up and left. Mantle onto a small ledge halfway up and work your way up the face. Sustained climbing on varied hold." (from Ontario Rock Climbing: The Best of Southern Ontario guidebook)

lines.name: Where's The Money Lebowski
lines.description: Climb up the small mossy face, then head right up a nice ramp towards the far right side of the Dude Fin. A small traverse left then pull onto the ledge with the anchors twenty feet right of Sunday Sausage.
lines.location: Located opposite to "Balls Deeper" on a small knife edge plateau.

lines.name: One Step Beyond
lines.description: Dirty as per all Gully routes. Hard start to easier top section.
lines.location: left of Strictly Ballroom, hidden around a corner.

lines.name: Private Dancer
lines.description: Perpetually wet climb on solid stone.  Sprouter of many bail biners throughout the season.
lines.location: Behind Dude Wall, descend into Yellow Card area then go right behind dude fin. First climb on left side.

lines.name: Safety Dance
lines.description: Awesome line on decent holds, pull the roof if you can get past the wet start.
lines.location: opposite Private Dancer, rightmost climb of the wall.

lines.name: So You Think You Can Dance
lines.description: The big line right up the middle, stretched out moves will bump the grade for shorter climbers.  As with all gully routes, damp start.

lines.name: Strictly Ballroom
lines.description: Fun route, poor rock.  Dirty and damp make this more of an adventure climb.
lines.location: Left of So You Think You Can Dance.

lines.name: Waltzing Matilda
lines.description: Short roof to a surprisingly nice crack.

lines.name: Welcome to Shang Gorilla
lines.description: Wet, slimy and insecure. Off angle corner.

lines.name: White Russian (Project)
lines.description: Sort of not really a route, put up but hard to piece together.

lines.name: Booty Duty
lines.description: easy climbing to a crux at the anchor.

lines.name: First Ascent Folies
lines.description: Crack climbing into a roof.

lines.name: Hamsterdam
lines.description: Great movement on solid stone, Venturing above anchors will yield loose rock.

lines.name: Ridden Hard and Put Away Wet
lines.description: Good 5.8 lead, last clip can be difficult for some.
lines.location: Start on Booty Duty and keep left.

lines.name: Scarlet Fever
lines.description: Solid 10d on a great piece of rock, perpetually wet however and seldom traveled.
lines.location: Left of Alex in Wonderland. on opposing wall.

lines.name: Wobbler
lines.description: Sketchy start on small regularly damp holds into easier more straightforwardness up top.

lines.name: Alpa Chino
lines.description: Couple of hard moves off the ground gets easier the higher you go, great holds on big moves and overhanging rock.
lines.location: around the corner to the left of Hump the Honeys, inside the gully. Can't miss it.

lines.name: The Big Boss
lines.description: Line of epic proportion, easy climbing that gets progressively harder.  Pull the roof and gain anchors.
lines.location: left of Curbed only climb on the wall.

lines.name: Chopped
lines.description: This route has been chopped.

lines.name: Cross-eyed Mary
lines.description: Bouldery crux about halfway up, to relatively easier juggy climbing to the anchors. Route was bolted to provide an out of the way mentoring location. Instructor can easily top out and sit on the upper ledge to instruct on anchor cleaning while being up close and personal but not in the way. opportunity to demonstrate use of extended or alpine draw under the ledge to reduce rope drag.
lines.location: Starts immediately right of  "12 Pump Chump" or directly across from "Pump the Honeys."

lines.name: Curbed
lines.description: Steep boulder problem leading into Loan Shark

lines.name: Easy 11a
lines.description: Thin opening moves and hard pulling with a tiptoe finish.  Short and stout.
lines.location: wall left of The Big Boss.

lines.name: Face Taco
lines.description: Banger crux off the ground on some cool holds.  Gets easier the higher you go.
lines.location: Opposite wall from Alpa Chino, Looks manky, but worth the time.

lines.name: Hatorade
lines.description: Pull easier moves on solid holds up to a small roof, gain some small crimps and move into a layback section.  Clip a long draw while on the ledge to reduce drag and pull some jugs to the anchor.
lines.location: First route on the left side from the crevice.

lines.name: Hump the Honeys
lines.description: Start of the arete, move out onto the face of the wall and follow the bolts.  Be solid on the first two clips, there is groundfall potential.

lines.name: Loan Shark
lines.description: Easy start with a 10c crux before the anchors.  Sweet moves, sweet rock. top notch.
lines.location: right of the log staircase heading towards the islands main wall.

lines.name: The Oz Man Cometh
lines.description: Easy pulling gains you a few strenuous moves at a small roof, hit the seam and throw for a jug. Easier climbing up top.

lines.name: Pump and Dump
lines.description: Genuine one move wonder.  large dynamic move protecting much easier flake jug hauling. put a sling on the last draw to avoid rope drag then run it out to the anchor.

lines.name: Pup Star
lines.description: Climb the face.

lines.name: Pushover
lines.description: Technical and somewhat powerful beginning, top section is much more dynamic and overhung.  Be wary of holds breaking from top section. Wear a helmet.
lines.location: First climb on the right of the second wall.

lines.name: Ride the Lightning
lines.description: A bouldery start will get you to a feature shaped like a lightning bolt. Continue up the face and cruise to the chains.

lines.name: The Sausage Factory
lines.description: One of the best 10a's around.  Steep and committing for the grade and not great for toproping.  Varied movements.
lines.location: Right most climb on the first main islands wall.

lines.name: Blood in the Water
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Business Time
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Cockroach
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Crib Midget
lines.description: Wide corner on the left upwards to good rock and a crux.

lines.name: Does Your Boyfriend Drive Too
lines.description: This route goes up the right side of a gully though you'll probably want to start on the rocks to the left because going directly up would be hard.

lines.name: Gerry Gerbil
lines.description: Goes diagonally left up a flake until shared anchors with hammy hamster

lines.name: Guns of the Patriots
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Hammy Hamster
lines.description: Trend right for the first two bolts then a bit left until #4. Then head up to shared anchors with Gerry gerbil

lines.name: Heisenberg
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Layback and Jam it In
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Community Crack
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: DDWM
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Guns N' Roses
lines.description: Pitch 1 - 5.9 to anchors. Pitch 2 - 10b to 3rd set of anchors. There is a chain anchor after topping out on the pinnacle. Use this as a belay for 2nd pitch.

lines.name: Just the Tip
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Pure Plaisir/Pixelated
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Scraping
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: She's A Tease
lines.description: A few bolts to a thin crack.

lines.name: Unknown
lines.description: Start on back of pinnacle and cross over to a crack that goes up headwall.  First pitch is an easy 5.9 and second pitch is 5.10a/b

lines.name: 12 Pump Chump
lines.description: A short and pumpy line on good holds that are consistently awkward to grasp. Good first for the grade if your a strong boulderer.
lines.location: Rightmost climb in Sector 9, start atop a rock shelf higher than the rest of the wall.

lines.name: ASSMAN
lines.description: Hard, reachy boulder problem spits you out before the great 5.12 climbing above.

lines.name: Balls Deeper
lines.description: Short Off width. Go DEEP.

lines.name: Godzilla
lines.description: Follow the corner to a thin groove, follow up towards a scoop. Go right and up to reach anchors.

lines.name: Meat Wagon Speedway
lines.description: Start directly below bolt #1, thin edges and thinner pockets.  Big moves in the middle get you onto an amazing headwall.
lines.location: first bolted route coming from west end.

lines.name: Mothra (Project)
lines.description: Still needs some route finding, hard project route.

lines.name: Rodan (project)
lines.description: Seeping roof and minuscule holds have held off a first ascent of this route.

lines.name: Coma Girl
lines.description: Hard crimpin off the deck and some hard moves leads into a small dihedral. Finish  on some steep jugs.

lines.name: Liquid Brain
lines.description: Start left of the first bolt, a difficult opening boulder sequence leads to a couple of more hard sequences and some chains.

lines.name: The Meat Grinder
lines.description: Difficult start with a few power moves gets easier towards the end.  Starting far left makes it easier, but will not be true to the grade.

lines.name: The Poppy Salesman
lines.description: Some cool layback moves gets you into position for a leftward traverse under a small roof.  Pull to the crack above and get you feet high.  Awesome finish.

lines.name: Seeing-Eye Bitch
lines.description: Crux start gets easier the higher you go. Great climb.

lines.name: Timex
lines.description: Easy technical start and a mellow headwall.  Crux is before the chains.

lines.name: Turf Builder
lines.description: Start in an easy crack and make your way up and out right to a ledge. The fun begins after as you follow the short undercling/lieback up the face.
lines.location: Large fingers to small hands. There's a fixed nut at the beginning of the crack. Anchors.

lines.name: Uno
lines.description: A difficult pocket at the roof on a reach move might have you questioning the grade if you're a shorter climber.  You might not even be able to reach the pocket if your. Easier climbing after that crux.

lines.name: White Rajahs
lines.description: Steep and Powerful roof to a nice crack system above.

lines.name: Alex in Wonderland
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Curve Ball
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: El Diablo
lines.description: 6? Bolts to rap rings

lines.name: Knuckle Ball
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Magic Man
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Shake and Bake
lines.description: Steep arete climbing eases up to more vertical above.

lines.name: Boom Boom Boom and it's Total Steep Sickness to the Chains
lines.description: 5.6 to the first set of anchors.   5.11a to the second set.

lines.name: Bubba Ho Tep
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Watch Your Back
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Chewie is my Co-Pilot
lines.description: Short and powerful, small seam cranking.

lines.name: The Lucifer Effect
lines.description: Start on Swamp Thing and move right up steep technical rock.

lines.name: Swamp Thing
lines.description: Classic.   Pocket pulling to a rest, steep section to tough roof moves.  Pull to the headwall and throw to a jug at the anchors.  Big air will ensue if you miss, good belaying is essential.
lines.location: Leftmost/westernmost route on the White Castle.

lines.name: The Weak and The Wounded
lines.description: Bouldering start guards easier steep rock.  Throw to a pocket and cash in your air miles if you miss.  Hold it down to the anchors.
lines.location: Start on The Wookie and move left to anchors.

lines.name: The Wookie
lines.description: Steep climbing on good holds, leave some for the end or pump out. A good first for the grade.

lines.name: Balls Deep
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Bermuda Highway
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Carbon Stihl
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Dancing With the Stars
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: The Down Low
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Fortune Teller
lines.description: Start left of Whoopee Cushion. Surmount the initial ledge and climb a nice slab boulder problem to fun jugs, and then find your way through an interesting final crux. Can get dirty due to runoff, but brush it up and it will reward you with super nice climbing and rock.
lines.location: First bolted route left of Whoopee Cushion, and right of Carbon Stihl.

lines.name: McLovin
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Moon Dance
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Stainless Stihl
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Stihl Your Face
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Whoopee Cushion
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Yellow Fever
lines.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

lines.name: Invisible Sun
lines.description: Layback up a flake.

lines.name: King of Pain
lines.description: Awesome pocket climbing up the face.

lines.name: Message in a Bottle
lines.description: Up the face 2nd from left.

lines.name: Secret Journey
lines.description: Leftmost route, climb the face. Duh.

lines.name: Synchronicity
lines.description: Climb the arete.

lines.name: Walking on the Moon
lines.description: Start in the hole, go up and right.

lines.name: Abdul's Crack
lines.description: Offwidth with somewhat lack of protection

lines.name: Amazing Grace
lines.description: Fun and nice climbing on a slightly overhanging wall. Crux up top after the pump has set in.

lines.name: Edgy
lines.description: Face and arete climb, short but a good warm up.
lines.location: Up a dirty ramp on the wall left of Corner Stone.

lines.name: The Fin
lines.description: Climb the bulgy arete.5.11a if using the crack on the left (Good Clean Fun) as well.

lines.name: Good Clean Fun
lines.description: Enjoyable and fun varying crack
lines.location: Use top anchors of The Fin

lines.name: Heart of Stone
lines.description: Excellent corner crack, exciting layback finish! Classic!

lines.name: Ivory Tower
lines.description: Start on a ramp and clip the first bolt, work around the aerate back to the face and move up on a mono and a few good holds.  Make the next few clips and run it out on some easy terrain to the 2nd last bolt, the sooner you clip the last bolt the better to save yourself some strenuous clip later.  Big huecos to finish on the exposed overhang.

lines.name: The Jester
lines.description: Reachy moves on smaller holds than it's neighbour Ladder Face.

lines.name: The Ladder Face
lines.description: A few curved cracks and a triangular hold gets you to a rest with a ton of horizontals to the finish.

lines.name: The Loner
lines.description: Face climbing to an overhanging finish.

lines.name: Music at Work
lines.description: Thin holds on the first half guard a squeeze job up top.

lines.name: Open Project (Minifly)
lines.description: Large overhanging bulge split by a seam and small corner.  Still awaits an ascent. 2 bolts and a single ring anchor.

lines.name: Paleface
lines.description: Steep and powerful, bring that dead point strength.

lines.name: Poets
lines.description: Start on Spaced Out and lean far right, small pockets and hard moves to anchors.

lines.name: Sentinel
lines.description: Blank looking face/arete of a white pillar.  Difficult sequences on what looks like nothing.
lines.location: Large white pillar with 3 climbs on it.

lines.name: Slap Happy
lines.description: An arete with not much to grasp, desperately slapping your way to the top.

lines.name: Space Odyssey
lines.description: Start on a ledge and follow up the arete, move onto the face and use the pockets to gain ground.  A few slopers and pockets on the headwall to anchors.

lines.name: Spaced Out
lines.description: 2-pitch sport climb, due to a large ledge and an incredible amount of rope drag it is advised to split this pitch in 2 so it doesn't feel like your dragging a truck up the overhang finish.

lines.name: Wild Orchid
lines.description: Thought provoking the entire way, lots of variety and a beautiful sequence. Classic!

lines.name: Blood Beach
lines.description: This route climbs the left hand side of the right cave. It sort of follows a seam. It is one of the steeper routes on the B-MW. Makes a great warm-up if you have it wired or can handle a good pump.
lines.location: Left side of the right cave. Shares a start with Pocket Rocket.

lines.name: Blood Sucking Pharaohs
lines.description: Pocket climbing to hard to see holds and then jugs at the top. It heads right after clipping the forth bolt. Chain anchor
lines.location: This is the 7th route from the left. The forth from the cave. It ends at the right set of chains.

lines.name: Brain Damage
lines.description: This route diagonals left along the right side of the left cave. It ends at the same anchor as They Live.
lines.location: It is on the outside of the right side of the left cave. This is the forth bolted line from the left.

lines.name: Bride of the Reanimator
lines.description: Boulder out the roof and over the lip to the ledge then work right around the corner and up to the anchor of Dollman.
lines.location: This route is left of Dollman and starts on the right side of the right cave and works right to the anchor of Dollman.

lines.name: The Corpse Vanishes
lines.description: This route climbs up to a small arete then onto chain anchors. Pretty good pockets, but some are hard to find at first.
lines.location: This route is the 6th from the far left. 3rd from the left cave. It ends at the left set of chain anchors.

lines.name: Creepers
lines.description: One of the longer routes it ends on a right facing dihedral. It climbs past pretty good holds, you just need to find them. The section just before the anchors is a pile of hollow sounding blocks. Climb gently.
lines.location: This route is on the wall between the two caves. It is the second on that part of the wall, just right of "Brain Damage" it is the 5th route overall from the left of the cliff.

lines.name: Deadzone
lines.description: This route is a linkup of sorts. This route starts on Blood Beach and does a rising traverse to the 4th bolt of Hitler's Brain. The bolts you are supposed to clip are supposed to be painted black but there might not be paint still on all of them. No stars because I haven't been on it yet.
lines.location: It starts on Blood Beach and finishes on Hitler's Brain.

lines.name: Dollman
lines.description: The route is pretty much all huge jugs. The start traverses left then you climb up to the Supershut anchor. There is a direct start to this route that is a bit harder and climbs pretty much straight up to the anchor. 5.8 doesn't get much steeper than this. Much more solid than it looks! Sharp holds.
lines.location: This route is just left of White Zombie and just right of the right cave. There is a direct start just below it.
lines.protection: Three bolts and anchors. This route is a bit runout but the bolts protect the hardest moves pretty well. The first bolt doesn't do much but make it harder to belay. So skip it, either with a stick clip or not. There are two more bolts for the direct start.

lines.name: Dollman Direct
lines.description: This is the direct start to Dollman and bumps the difficulty from 5.8 to 5.10a. If you traverse in from the right, that is the 5.8 variation. A difficult start and pocket pull lead to jugs.

lines.name: Evil Dead
lines.description: Just left of Hitler's Brain and right of The Punisher. Might be a little tougher if you are short. No stars because I haven't been on it yet, it is supposed to be a pretty decent route.
lines.location: 10th route from the far left. 3rd route left of Blood Beach.

lines.name: Hell on Earth
lines.description: This route is just right of Hellraiser and shares and anchor with it. Power climbing on pretty good holds for the most part. Don't stray to far left and onto Hellraiser around the third bolt when the holds get small for a couple moves.
lines.location: On the left side of the left cave.

lines.name: Hellbound
lines.description: This route is an extension to Hellraiser. There is a bouldery move to get the lip of the roof. It is a bit harder since a hold broke. The grade listed is approximate.
lines.location: Climb Hellraiser and keep going up through the roof.

lines.name: Hellraiser
lines.description: One of the routes often used as a warm-up. There is a big left facing flake thing about 1/3 to half way up.
lines.location: This is the furthest route to the Left. It starts just left of the left cave and climbs along the edge of the cave.

lines.name: Mars Need's Women
lines.description: A hard start then bigger pockets lead up to a big block/shelf. Climb along the left edge of the block/shelf and through the small awkward roof to bigger holds above.
lines.location: This is the second bolt line left of Blood Beach. There is an oddball bolt under the ledge/shelf that often confuses people. That bolt is the third bolt of Deadzone. This route is the 12th from the left end of the cliff.

lines.name: Pocket Rocket
lines.description: Big holds separated by big moves on steep rock. Shares a start with Blood Beach but heads right at third bolt and the shelf.
lines.location: Starts on the left side of the right cave. Shares a start and first three bolts with Blood Beach and then climbs just to the right of BB.

lines.name: The Punisher
lines.description: Pretty decent holds with bad feet. Powerful. Mostly pockets. This route is probably the first or second route you will see when you get to the cliff. Big, somewhat dirty holds quickly get you into the real climbing. It ends at a wiggly pig tail and glue-in bolt anchor Many people lower off the anchor for Mars Needs Women when cleaning. Others just lower off the one wiggly pigtail.
lines.location: This it the second bolt line left of Blood Beach. Or the 11th from the far left of the cliff. It is just left of "Mars Need's Women".
lines.protection: 5 bolts and something resembling an anchor.

lines.name: Reanimator
lines.description: Steep climbing up a big flake leads to a dirty shelf and more steep climbing out of the cave on pockets. Due to frail holds stickclipping the first bolt isn't a bad idea.
lines.location: Just left of Bride of the Reanimator. This is the center route in the right cave.

lines.name: Repoman
lines.description: Bouldery in spots.
lines.location: This route is near the center of the wall. 8th from the left. Just right of BSP and left of Hitler's Brain.

lines.name: Subspecies
lines.description: Link up of Bride of the Reanimator into the Reanimator. It would be a lot harder if it didn't have a good rest between the two hard parts.

lines.name: They Live
lines.description: Steep climbing to pockets on the right side of the left cave. Stick clip the second bolt since the first bolt is obviously bad. I haven't been on this route yet so I didn't give it any stars. It is supposed to be quite good. A few holds have broken. Could be tough for the grade.
lines.location: Right side of the left cave.

lines.name: They Live Above
lines.description: An extension to they live. After reaching the anchor for "They Live" head up and right to the big roof. There is a bolt part way out the roof. Pull the lip and climb to the anchor. Supposedly it can be conditions dependent. I haven't been on this route yet so I didn't give it any stars.
lines.location: The roof above the anchor of They Live.

lines.name: They Saved Hitler's Brain
lines.description: Bouldery with pretty small holds for this wall and a tough 4th clip. The route kinda zigzags at the bottom and then pretty well follows the bolts from the third up. There is a big pocket just below the third bolt. Cool moves.
lines.location: Near the center of the wall. Just right of Repoman. 9th route from the left overall. 6th from the left cave. 4th from the left of Blood Beach.

lines.name: Unknown
lines.description: This is the crack that goes out the center of the left cave. I haven't done it and don't know the name. The rating is just a guess since they make you list one. It looks tough. There is a pin at the start and a couple of fixed wires along the way.
lines.location: The center of the left cave.
lines.protection: Gear plus one fixed pin and a couple of fixed nuts. Lower off one of the sport route anchors to the side.

lines.name: White Zombie
lines.description: This route starts below a right facing corner and climbs up to a ledgy area and then trends left and up over the roof.
lines.location: This route is the furthest route to the right on the B-MW

lines.name: Keep Summer Safe
lines.description: Techy first pitch (5.11+?) then only a huge ledge with anchors. Either bring up your 2nd or clip your rope through the first permadraw for the traversing prow (back clean the anchors if you are doing the route in one pitch). 6 or 7 permadraws to the anchors. Super fun movement on some good pockets/huecos and some bad sloping edges. Classic!
lines.location: Bolted hangers for first pitch, permadraws on second pitch.

lines.name: The Monument
lines.description: The route EVERYONE wants to do, but it rarely gets done. This nearly horizontal 30 foot roof is massive and split by a fist/hand crack that pinches to fingers just before the lip.      Climb the chossy looking face until it is possible to start using the crack. The rock is more solid than it looks, but use caution.      Climb the easy, slightly overhanging crack up to the roof then take a deep breath before leaning back and seeing how far away the lip looks. After choking back down the vomit, fight the pump and work your way out to the lip. The crux is gaining the lip. Once established at the lip it is easy climbing to the anchor.      The route seeps most of the year and the black rock can be extremely slippery. Once it drys out, the crack usually needs a light brushing the first time out it.      This route is best cleaned by aiding it on toprope. Some people just leave the roof fixed and pinkpoint. Knock at least a letter grade off if you do this.
lines.location: At the far end of the cliff. 5-10 min from the B-MW. The second you see it you will know you are at it.
lines.protection: Cams up to #4 Camalot with doubles of the 3&4 sizes. A double of the #2 size can be useful for cleaning purposes. There are a few fixed wires on the section before the roof that are asked to be left in place. Lower from the anchor.

lines.name: She's So Hexy
lines.description: Tough bouldery start (unless you have really thin fingers). Some small placements in the crack, then place a #6 halfway up in the obvious off-width that you can laybacks through. Remember to extend your pieces in the upper corner before traversing out towards the anchors. A medium size hex could protect the traverse... You can stay high or low for the traverse. Definite classic!
lines.location: 0.3 to #4. #6 highly suggested down low. Optional medium hex for the traverse finish.
